Edward & Agace hys wẏf, & her chẏldren þre
þe ȝonge Lege, Edgar Athelyng, cum Ar. Edward Adelẏng, & also Margarete,
And Christiene Ar. Cristẏne her soster, þat god were & suete.
þo hii come to Engelond, glad was þe kẏng þo,
Vor he nadde in hẏs fader alf kunnesmen nanmo.
þys was in a þousend ȝer & seuene & fẏftẏ þerto
As in ȝer of ȝrace, þat þẏs dede was ẏdo.
Ac Edward deẏde sone, & ẏbured was wẏþ gret prute
At Seyn Poule's at Londone, as hẏs bones beþ ȝute:
And hẏs sone Repone, Edgar, cum Ar. Edward bote ȝong & tendre nas,
þeruore þe kẏng vor hys deþ þe sorrore was.
For his sone Edgar to ẏonge was kẏng to be Ar. Vor þat chẏld was wel ȝong, eẏr & kẏng to be,
And he wuste wel, þat in þe lond Muche stryf shulde be Ar. muche wo me ssolde y se.
And vor hẏs vncle in Normandẏe hẏm adde Susteẏned Ar. ẏusteẏned er,
þo he was Fleme Ar. fleyne & frendeles, Negh XXX. Ar. mo þan þruttẏ″ ȝer,
He wolde, þat hẏs sone sone after hẏm kyng were
Wẏllam duc of Normandie, rẏȝt lawe þey ẏt nere.
For in his moder half quene Em∣me he was the next bloode, And as for the londe's prough him thought none so goode Ar. Vor he was in hẏs moder alf next of hys blod,
And þer nas non in hẏs fader alf þat þer to was so god.
þer uore þys Wẏllam bastard Engelond he bẏhet,
And byqueþ in hẏs deþ vnel, ar he þat lẏf let.
And þat muche vor þe londe's prou, vor hẏs neuen so ȝong was.

Hou Metra hac de re desunt in Ar. in quo tamen sequentia, eo pertinentia, narravit scrip∣tor prosaicus, quibus similia itidem videas tam in Poly∣chronico, quam & in Lelandi nostri Collect. Vol. VI. p. 296. After him [Richarde the IIIde.] Robert his sone [was duc of Normandye,] a man of grete worthinesse. After him Wil∣liam Bastard, of wham this geste folweth. Robert duc of Normandẏe in a tẏme as he dwelled in a toune of Nor∣mandie, i cleped Faleys, he caste his chere to a mayde in the toune, that me cleped Herlote. And, when sheo was brought to the duke's bedde, and shulde go therto, she toke her smok a boue atte coler hem, and rent hit doune to the foot, and leide it a weẏ fram hure. And whenne sheo was esshet, whẏ she dude soo? she answered and seide, hit was nat curtasẏe ne reson that thinges, that touched her feet & hure lowe thynges, shuld touche her lorde's mouthe ne visage, & so thulke same nẏght the duc gat on her William Bastard. And after hure slepe sheo a woke, and made a grete gronẏng and syghẏng. So that the duc hurẏng that, esshet of hure, why sheo sighed so? And sheo answered, Lord ich haue worderliche [f. wonderliche] i mette. Me thought, quod sheo, that a grete tree growe oute atte my wombe, and by shadowed alle Norman∣dye. And after, whenne hit came to the tyme, when the childe was i bore, a non, þourgh negligence of women attendẏng a boute his moder forẏetẏng hẏm, he was wal∣wed into the strawe that was bẏ, and had caught his. ii. hondes so fulle ther of, that vnnethe, with oute grete harme, me mẏght delẏuere hit oute of his hondes. Wher∣for, muche folke demed, he shulde wexe to summe grete auoire of worlde's ricchesse. And as this childe was after in norẏsshẏng in Valeẏs, a grete man [sic haec concipiun∣tur] of the contre, I hote William Tallmage. So that a burgeẏs, where as this childe was in norẏsshẏng, praẏde this William to come to his house, and visite his lorde's sone. This William Tallenage & alle his kynne hadde euer i hated this childe's fader and his kynne, and ẏut not withstondẏng that he cam to the hous, wher this childe was inne. And as non as this childe, that vnnethe coude speke, saugh him, sodeẏneliche hit gan chide towardes this man, and so ferde towardes him, that me toke grete hede there of, supposyng hit myght nat be withoute grete ordi∣naunce of God. Wyllam bastard was bẏȝyte, Icholle telle þat cas.
Rychard duc of Normandye, Emme broþer þe quene,
Adde a sone, þat het Roberd, þat duc was suþþe, Ich wene.
Roberd, þys noble duc, as he wende ouer lond,
A wel vayr maẏde, as hẏm þoȝte, matresche he vond.
þẏs mayde hẏm paẏde suyþe wel, mẏd god wille he hẏr nom,
And huld hẏre as hẏs lefmon, as wo seẏþ in hordom,
And byȝet on hẏre þẏs Wẏllam, &, vor he was so ẏbore
Out of spoushod, me cluped hẏm Wyllam bastard þeruore.
Ar þat chẏld were ẏbore, a wel wonder cas
þe moder mette bẏ hẏre chẏld, þat in hẏr wombe was,
þat hẏs gottes were to drawe aboute al Normandẏe,
And eke aboute al Engelond, þat was to sẏgnẏfẏe,
þat he ssolde be duc of Normandẏe, & kẏng of Engelond,
And bothe, as ẏt suþþe vel, holde in hẏs honde.
þe chẏld ek þo ẏt was ẏbore, & to grounde com,
Out of hẏs moder wombe verst, boþe hẏs honden he nom
Vol of þe poudre & of þe erþe sturnelẏche ẏnou,
And closedes to gader & hẏs fustes boþe adrou.
þo was yt jugged, þat he ssolde be, wẏþ oute faẏle,
Hardẏ kẏng & stalwarde, & muche do of bataẏle.
Al yt bycom to soþe suþþe. he bygan ȝong ynou,
To cuþe wat he wolde be, þat so ȝong hẏs fustes adrou.
þat chẏld wax so wel & ẏþen, as seẏde fremde & sẏbbe,
þat he wolde be a noble mon, ȝẏf he moste lybbe.
Hẏs fader adde of hym eke gret joẏe & prẏs,
þat so gode sẏgne adde so ȝong, to be stalwarde & wẏs.
Ar he were of sene ȝer old. þoru out monẏ a lond
þe pope sende creẏserẏ toward þe holẏlond.
Roberd duc of Normandẏe þe croẏs nom atten ende,
And ȝarked hẏm wẏþ oþere to þe holylonde to wende.
At Festamp, ar he wende vorþ, he made al Normandẏe
Suerẏe, holde hẏs ȝong sone, as to seẏgnorẏe.
ȝong duc he was on of sene ȝer vnneþe.
Vor þe fader ne com neuere aȝen, ar he were broȝt to deþe.
And þẏs ȝong chẏld byleued duc, & gret þyng adde an honde.
þẏs was ar Seẏnt Edward were kẏng of Engelond.
And Seẏnt Edward byleuede vorþ mẏd hẏm, as he adde er ẏdo
Myd hys fader in hys nede, & mẏd hẏs grantsyre al so.
þeruore þo he was kẏng, gret loue he gan bede
þẏs Wyllam, vor hii susteẏned hẏm so in hys nede.
So þat suþþe in hẏs elde, þo hẏs lẏf was neẏ ydo,
As in þe ȝer of hys kẏnedom tuentẏ & tuo,
Of þe croune of Engelond he nuste wat best do,
Vor Edgar, hys neuen sone, wel ȝong was þerto
To be kẏng of Engelond, & hẏs owe lyf ssoȝt was,
And he dradde of gret contek alonde vor þat cas.
Hym þoȝte to ȝẏue Wyllam þẏs lond, hyt was best to do.
Vor he was wurþe, & of hẏs blod, & best ẏt couþe wyte also.
þeruor he ȝaf ẏt hẏm, as he byhet hẏm byuore,
And sende to hẏm mẏd þe ȝẏfte to Normandye þeruor
þe erl Harald þe quene broþer, as me wende, & oþer mo.
Ac soþ ẏt ẏs, þat þe erl Harald passede þe see þo,
Wẏþ gret poer & folc ẏnou, so þat, as God ẏt wolde,
Wyþ wẏnd he was in strange londe ẏdrẏue, þer he nolde.

þere hii were, as strange men, Greuẏliche vnderfonge In Sir Guẏ de Pounsoun's lond, and i prisoned wonder strong. And whenne theẏ hadde ther a while thus i dwelte in bende, Sir Guy as∣ked hem Raunson grete, of prison for to wende Ar. grẏmẏlẏche undervonge,
And ẏnome to albe of here, & ybroȝt in bendes stronge.
Sẏr Gwẏ of Pountyn was hẏs name, þat hẏm adde in bende,
And asked hem gret ramson, in prison vorto wende.
Harald was of heẏe herte, & suor raþer he wolde
ȝẏue þe duc of Normandẏe of hẏs tresor & of hys golde,
þat so noble duc was & god, Than suche half man Ar. þan a such alue man as he was.
To þe duc he sende sone, to helpe hẏm in þat cas.
þe duc sende to Sẏr Gwẏ, so That he a non Ladde Harolde tho to him, and his felawes echon Ar. þat Sẏr Gwẏ anon
And adde Harald to þe duc, & hys felawes echon.
þe duc vaẏre hẏm vnderuong, & honoured hẏm ẏ nou,
So þat, as ryȝt was, gret loue bytuene Hem drowgh. Harold than, to queme the duc, seide sone his sonde, Ar. hẏm drou.
Harald, vor to paẏe hẏm wel, sende hẏm sone hẏs sonde,

Hou þe kẏng hym Maked after his daẏ heire of Engelond. And Harold swor to the duc, and to him fast bonde, That to his bẏ houe al on he wolde kepe the londe, And that the duke's doughter, whenne that tẏme come, That ẏong was thoo, in foreward to wẏf Harolde nome. And thus Harolde was i swor to do thes thinges twoo With also gret othe & bonde, as men mẏght doo Ar. made after hẏm hys eẏr of hẏs londe.
And þat he wolde take hẏm to wẏte hẏs lond he vnderstode
To hẏs bẏefþe, & þat he wolde wardeẏn be hẏm god.
As strong vorewarde as hii mẏȝte hii made & as hard,
And vp holẏ relẏkes Harald suor to Wẏllam bastard,
Treulyche to wyte Engelond to hẏm, vorte he come,
And þat he hẏs one doȝter to wẏue also nome,
þat ȝond was at þulke tẏme, so þat hys þẏnges tuo
Wyþ as gret oþ he suor hẏm, as man myȝte do.
þo þẏs vorewarde was ẏmad hard & strong ẏ nou,
Harald toward Engelond wẏþ gode loue drou.
þe kẏng he tolde al þat cas, þat bẏtuene hem was ẏdo,
Hou he wolde to Wyllam trywe be, an hys doȝter spousy al so.
þo was þe kyng glad ynou, þat he wel to hẏm truste,
And bẏ toke him all the londe, to the duc that he wẏst Ar. And bẏtot hym þat lond, þat he wel to þys Wyllam ẏt wuste.
Seynt Edward wuste of hẏs deþ, ar he henne wende.
Vor Seẏnt Jon euuangelẏst bẏuore longe word sende,
And sende hẏm tokne by a rẏng, þat at Westmynstre ȝut ẏs,
þat Seynt Edward þer bẏuore Seyn Jon ȝef ẏwẏs.
þe kẏng þo þet word hẏm com, & þen rẏng ẏseẏ,
He þonkede God þat he wuste, þat hẏs deþ was so neẏ.
Hẏs gode he delde pouere men, & made hẏs bernes bare,
And hẏs tresorẏe al so god, & to God hẏm made al ȝare.
Glad he was of Westmynstre þat he Lette vppe a rere Ar. let hẏm sulf rere,
þat bẏuore hẏm was ẏbroȝt to grounde, þoru luþer kẏnges þat were.
Ac For the churche Ar. vorþ chẏrche vnhalwed was, þeruor hẏm was wo.
He þoȝte To habbe halwed hur atte midwẏnter thoo Ar. lete hẏs halwẏ to mẏdewẏnter anon þo.
þeẏ Seyn Peter hymsulf Her hadde halwed er Ar. ẏhalwed adde er,
ȝut he moste efsone vor þe nẏwe worke þere.
He sende after hẏs Ba∣rons, Ar. baronẏe, at mẏdewẏnter Negh pro mẏd in Ar. mẏd hẏm to be.
þo þe feste ẏgadered was, deol me mẏȝte ẏse.
Vor þo ẏt ssolde murgost be, þe kyng vnelede anon.

And naþeles glad he was hẏm sulf, For he wiste hoder gon. ẏut bare he the crowne, & helde the deẏs with other a tẏre also, And with gret chere iii. daẏes helde his feste so. A Seẏnt Johen's day, of all to make good endẏng, He confermed bẏ his chartre in all maner thẏng To West∣mẏnstre the fredomes i vsed ẏut huder to, And ho that a ẏenst hem ought dude, let sentence ther on doo. The churche he lette halwe a Chil∣dermasse day Ar. vor he wuste gon.
And vor joẏe of hẏs deþe, & vor þe heẏe feste also,
þe trauaẏl he nome to hẏm al, þat hem wolde vane to do.
He ber þe croune, & huld þe deẏs mẏd oþer atẏl al so,
And mẏd gret semblant þe feste huld vorte þre dawes were ẏdo.
A Seyn Jone's day he seẏ þat al com to god endynge,
He made ac conferment to Westmynstre of eche þẏnge,
þat þoru hẏm hem ẏȝẏue was, oþer þoru eny oþer kẏnge,
So þat no kẏng after hẏm ne dude no destour brynge.
þe chẏrche he let halwẏ as a Chẏldery masse daẏ.
Wel feble he was þere hẏm sulf, as al The Ar. þat folc ẏ saẏ.
In a þousend ȝer of grace, & sẏxe & sẏxtẏ þerto,
Hẏt was þat þẏs holẏman þys dede let do.
þo hẏt was al wel ẏdo, & ẏbroȝt to god ende,
þe kẏng feble & sẏk ynou to hẏs bed gan wende.
þo was þer deol & sorwe ynou of men þat wuste þat cas,
Vor hii wuste, þat to Engelond muche wo to come was.
Worre & slaȝt, and oþer wo, & honger & gret wou.
þe quene vel bẏ hẏm adoun, & byclupte hẏm vaste ẏnoȝ
Vorto hete hẏs colde lymes, þat non hete ne come to,
þoru hete of hẏre owe bodẏ, & of hẏre cloþes al so.
þe kyng lay as he were ysuowe almest dawes tuo.
He gan, as he awoke of slepe, hẏs eyen þo vn do.
He sat Upwardes on his bedde, Ar. vpard vp hẏs bed, hẏs honden held vp anheẏ.
"Louerd," he seẏde, "þat ech þẏng madest queynte & sleẏ,
"And changest Power and kyngdom atte thẏne awne wille, And mannes sonns sendest wreche of his fader's ille Ar. poer & kẏnedoms alat þẏ nowe rede,
"And monne's sones wreche senst of her fader mẏs dede,
"ȝẏf þẏng, þat ẏch nou ẏseẏ, Come shall of thẏ Rightwesnesse, Ar. come of þẏ soþnesse,
"ȝet me poer yt to telle in al my feblesse,
"Vorto ssewe þẏ poer, þat hii þat yt ẏseþ
"Douty þe, & of þe sẏnne, þat hii in beþ,
"Repentẏ mowe, & þer of hem amendẏ so,
"And pray the shilde hem fro the harme, that thow hem thenkest doo Ar. þat hii ssulde hem fram þe harm, þat þou þencst hem do.
Anon as þẏs holymon Hadde doo his prayere, Strong i now his speche was Ar. adde hẏs oryson ẏ do þere,
Stalward man of speche he was, holy man as he were,
þo gan he to Segge Ar. tellen þus: "þulke tẏme þat ych was
"Flemed man in Nor∣mandẏe, me cam Ar. As man fleẏne in Normandye, me com monẏ god cas.
"Men of relẏgyon ẏch louede wel ẏ nou,
"An to me hem, þat best were, By fore Ar. at vore alle oþer ych drou.
"Ac ii. holy men be fore Ar. An tuene holẏ men at vore alle oþer mest yc louede þere.

"Nou wot ẏch wel, þat Ma∣nẏ a daẏ bothe in heuen they were. And now ryght bothe hii come to me, and the an∣gwysses some Hii tolde me, that Ar. adeo ut in Cod. nostro Harleyano metrum in∣tegrum omittatur. monẏ daẏ in heuene boþe hii were.
"Hii tolde me, þat to Engelond after me ssolde come.

"Hii seẏde me of þe wrecchede, That longe in londe hath be, Of whiche the wreche hiegh faste, as me shall i see. For Prestes with vnclene hondes, and with lecherous mode, All i foẏled, vseth to sacre Godde's flesh & blode Ar. þat alonde aþ ȝare ẏbe.
"þe wreche hẏeþ & sone comeþ. & þat ssal me ẏse.
"Vor prestes, mẏd vnclene honde & mẏd lechor's mode
"Al soẏled, sacrẏeþ Gode's fless & hys blod.
"Ssepurdes hii Beth Ar. bet luþer, vor hii ne Ke∣peth Ar. wẏteþ noȝt
"Her ssep fram þe Wolues, to hem that buthe by taught Ar. wolues. vor be hem ybroȝt
"þe melke & þe wolle clene. of oþer Thẏnges nele I tell Ar. þẏng hii nolle telle.
"þe ssepurdes and þe ssep Also bothe shulleth to Hell. And also Robbers of the londe high mennes felewes beth. Power men, that hii mowe, hii buẏldeth as ẏe seeth Ar. al so ssulle to pẏne of helle.
"As god heẏmen of þe lond robbeors felawes beþ.
"Pouere men, þat hii mowe ouer, hii huldeþ as ȝe ẏseþ.
"Nou wole vr Louerd ssake hys suerd, hys bowe ẏs ẏbend,
"And Redy Ar. prest aþ ẏmade, vorto smẏte men þat bet mẏswende.
"þo seyde ẏch mẏd drerẏ mode, ȝẏf hii wolleþ turne her þoȝt,
"An sorẏ be, & Let Ar. bete her sẏnne, wolle vr Louerd vorȝẏue hem oȝt?
"þat ẏs vor noȝt," þe oþer seẏde, "vor þe folke's herte ẏs
"So ẏharded, þat hii beþ blynde & deue ywẏs,
"þat hii nolleþ non god þẏng ẏhure ne ẏse.
"þo seẏde ẏch, Whether oure Ar. wer vr Louerd wole euere wroþ be,
"Whe∣ther he woll yet grace Ar. Wer he nolle grace do, & be of mẏlce more?
"Wanne þat lond, after so gret joẏe, so vol worþ of sore,
"Wat ende ssal þerof be, & wanne enẏ blẏs,
"Oþer comfort, after such sor?" þo seẏde þe oþer þys:
"A grene wexẏng tre, þat ẏs fram hẏs more
"Ismyte adoun, & þe brede of þe þre londes þerfram ybore,
"Wanne ẏt ẏs eft bẏ hẏm sulue, wẏþout ech monne's rede,
"Iturnd aȝen to hẏs rẏȝte more, þat er was as dede,
"And bẏgẏnþ to blowe, & suþþe to bere frut,
"þanne me maẏ, wo ẏt Seeth, for bote Ar. ẏsucþ, to bote hopye ȝut.
þo þe quene, & hẏre broþer Harald, hurde þẏs,
And Roberd, þat wardeyn was of þe palays ẏwẏs,
Hii wepe, & made deol ẏ nou, vor hii seẏe þe soþnesse,
How in lecherie Ar. In wuche lecherẏe & oþer sẏnne þe prestes songe her masse;
And hou þe heẏe men of þe lond þe pouere to grounde broȝte,
þe wreche, þat God wolde do, nas noȝt vor noȝt hii þoȝte.
þe sẏȝte bytokneþ þus, as ẏt was vnderstonde:
þẏs tre þe noble kynedom bẏtokneþ of Engelonde.
þe more bytokneþ þe rẏȝte kunde, þat ech of oþer come,
Fram kẏng Alfred The mo∣narke, tha anoẏnted was atte Rome, Ar. þe kunde more, þat furst was ẏheled at Rome,
To Seẏnt Edwarde's fader, & to hẏm sulue al so.
Ac þo he deẏde wẏþoute ryȝt eẏr, þe wexẏnge was ẏdo,
And þat tre ẏsmẏte fram þe more ouer þre londes brede.
Vor þe kẏnges were of Engelond of vn kunde sede.
Verst Harald þe quene broþer, & Wẏllam bastard also,
And suþþe hẏs sone Wẏllam, þe rede kẏng, þerto.
Ac after þat Wẏllam, þe rede kẏng, ẏssote was bẏ cas,
And þe gode Henrẏ hẏs broþer after hẏm kẏng was,
Seynt Edwarde's nece, þat of hẏs fader kunde come,
And of þe rẏȝte kunde of Engelond, kẏng Henrẏ to wyue nome,
þat was Mold þe gode quene, þat in gode tẏme was ẏbore;
þo smot verst þẏs tre aȝen to hẏs kunde more,
And Normandẏ þoru þe kyng, & þoru þe quene Engelond
Joẏned were þo kundelẏche in one monne's honde.

Whenne Seynt Edwarde thus tolde, he ganne to close his eyghe, The iiii. day of Januare thenne ganne he deye, In the yere of oure Lorde. Ml. lxvi. right After that oure swete Lorde in his moder a light. Kyng he was. xxiii. yere and vi. moneths ther too, And iii. wokes and vi. dayes er his lyf was i doo. Al the fraunchise Ar. In a þosend ȝer of grace & sẏxe & sẏxty rẏȝt,
After vr suete Louerd in hẏs moder was alẏȝt.
Kẏng he was þre & tuentẏ ȝer, & sẏx monþes þerto,
And þre woke & sẏxte dawes, ar hẏs lẏf were ẏdo.
þo Seynt Edward adde þẏs ẏtold, he closede boþe hẏs eẏe,
And þe verþe daẏ of Janẏuere in þẏs manere gan deye.
Al þe franchẏse of Engelond, & al joẏe & blẏsse,
Mẏd hẏm was vaste ẏbured, þo me bured hẏm ẏwẏs.
And þat me vond sone afterward mẏd monẏ deluol cas.
At Westmẏnstre a tuelfþe daẏ þẏs gode man ẏbured was.
HARALD þẏs false erl, þo Seynt Edwarde dede laẏ,
Hẏm sulue he let crounẏ kẏng þulke sulue daẏ
Falslẏche. vor Seẏnt Edward so wel to hẏm truste,
Thenne he by toke him Ar. þat he bẏtot hẏm Engelond, þat he ẏt wel wuste
To Williame's bẏ houe Ar. Wyllamme's byofþe bastard, duc of Normandẏe.
Ac hẏm sulf he made kẏng With fals trechourie Ar. mẏd such trecherẏe.
Ac þe gode tryw men of þe lond wolde Haue maked Ar. abbe ẏmade kẏng
þe kunde eẏr, þe ȝonge chẏld, Edgar Aþelyng.
He that were nexte kyng by kynde, Ethelẏng he was, And there fore me cleped hym so, for nexte heire he was Ar. Wo so were next kẏng bẏkunde, me clupeþ hẏm Aþelyng.
þeruor me clupede hẏm so, vor bẏkunde he was next kẏng.
Ac Harald made hẏs weẏ bẏuore, All with swikeldom, With yeftes and with faire bẏ hestes, to vonge the kyngdom Ar. as mẏd suykedom,
Mẏd ȝẏftẏs & myd vayre byheste, & auong þe kẏnedom.
So þat somme hẏm chose alout, & somme hem hulde stẏlle,

And suffred thulke tẏme as men that mẏght not haue her wille. So that Harolde to wrothur hele helde the kyng∣dome, And sone, as Seynt Ed∣warde seide, after ward hit come. And thoo by ganne the wrake ferste, as all men mẏght i see Ar. And soffrede as hii noȝt ne mẏȝte al oþere's wẏlle.
So þat Harald was kẏng, to wom þe hele þe kẏnedom.
And Seẏnt Edwarde's sẏȝte bẏ hẏm to soþe come.
Vor þo bẏgan þe wow vorst, as me mẏȝte ẏse,
þat ssolde, as Seẏnt Edward seẏde, bẏ þre kẏnges day be.
Vor Pro Toste. At in Ar. Tostyn, Harolde's. Coste, Harald broþer, þat he drof er in to Flaundre
Bẏ kẏnge's daẏ Edward hym sulue to gret sclaundre,
He com anon þo vppen hẏm mẏd gret poer & eẏe,
Mẏd Harald Lege, Harfager. Darfager kẏng of Norþweẏ,
And myd gret poer of Norþomber to Euerwẏk hii com,
And muche Folke, that hem with stode, bothe slawe Ar. folc in þe Souþ syde boþe slowe″ & nome.
Kẏng Harald com aȝen hym mẏd poer strong ẏnou.
A lite bẏ side Euerwik the hostes ge∣der drough, Ar. Bẏsyde Euerwẏk hẏs ost aȝen hẏm he drou,
In a stude, þat me clupede Staẏne∣forde Ar. Stamford brugge þo,
And nou me clupeþ ẏt Batayle brugge, vor þe bataẏle þat was þo.
þer hii smẏte to gadere, & made a sorẏ pleẏ.
Vor þere was Tost aslawe, & þe kẏng of Norþweẏ,
And her sẏde Was all bẏ ne∣the; to ende cam hit thoo Ar. al byneþe; to end ẏt com so
þat Seynt Edward byuore seẏde of þelke breþeren tuo,
þat hii ssolde to gadere fẏȝte, & Harald aboue be.
Ther of me myght atte thulke tẏme all the sothe i see. Fram ernemorwe fort hit was myddeouer none, The Ar. þer me mẏȝte of þulke word þat soþnesse ẏse.
Fram anon amorwe vorte myd ouer none,
þo″ bataẏle laste strong, ar Hit Ar. he were ẏdon,
þe Englysse ouer þe brugg droue þe oþer at laste.
Ac þo þat water was bẏtuene, hii stode aȝen vaste.
A man ther was Ar. On bodẏ þer was of Norþweẏ, betere nas þer non.
Vor he at stode vp þe brugg mẏd anax al on,

And drof the Englysse men aȝen, That non myght him withstande. And slough him self fourty with a sparthe in hande. So atte laste vnder him pryuẏ∣liche on came lowe, And in the foundement him smote, that he deide in a throwe. Then were the Englysshmen a boue in lẏtell stounde, And passed the brugge, and slowe downe to grounde. Tho Ar. hym ne myȝte non atstonde.
And slou mo þan fourtẏ of hem mẏd hẏs owe honde,
And wuste hem so vorte after none vorte on mẏd gẏle nome
A ssyp, & ar he were ywar vnder þe brugg com,
And smot hẏm ar he were ẏwar vnder foundement lowe
Mẏd a sper, & so an heẏ, þat he deẏde in a þrowe.
A stalwarde pece þat was, nou God cuþe hys soule loue.
þo þoȝte þe Englẏsse vor hẏs deþ þat hii were al aboue,
And passede þe brugge anon, & slowe to grounde,
So þat þe oþer partẏe bẏneþe was in astounde.
þo″ Harald ẏseẏ hẏs broþer aslawe, And Harolde Herfager, He toke gret pruẏte ther of, and helde non his pere, And ẏelde not well Ar. & þe kyng Arfager
Of Norþweẏ & her folc, he ne huld nour hẏs pere.
He ne ȝeld noȝt wel her mede, þat wẏþ hẏm hẏs fon slowe,
þeruore hẏs men þe lasse her herte to hym drowe.
And þat hii kudde hẏm afterwarde, aȝen Willam bastard,
As ẏe mowe ther of hure he after [f. here after] warde Ar. As ȝe ssole sone ẏhure, vor he was euere assreward.
MUCHE aþ he sorwe ẏbe ofte in Engelond,

As ẏe mowe i hure bẏ wrẏt, as Ich vnderstande, Of ma∣ny batailles that hath i be of men this londe that nome, Of Giauntes ferste & Bru∣tonus, and suth of men of Rome. Of Saxons suthe and Danes thenne, and Norman∣nus atte laste. And yut there wolle be more wrake, Icham fulle sore a gaste Ar. As ȝe mowe here & er yhure & vnderstonde,
Of monẏ bataẏle þat aþ ybe, & þat men þat lond nome,
Verst, as ȝe abbeþ ẏhurd, þe emperours of Rome.
Suþþe Saxons & Englysse mẏd bataẏles stronge.
Atte laste heẏ of Normandye, þat maystrus bet ȝut here,
Wonne ẏt & holdeþ ȝut, ẏ cholle telle in wuche manere.
Hîc perplura prosaice ha∣bentur in Ar. haud paucis nimirum metris in eodem praetermissis. þo Willam bastard hurde telle of Haralde's suẏkedhede,
Hou he hadde ẏmad hym kẏng, & mẏd wuch fals hede.
Vor þat lond hẏm was bẏtake, as hẏt welle wuste,
To wẏte ẏt to hẏm wel, & he wel to hẏm truste.
As þe hende he dude verste, & messagers hym sende,
"þat he vnderstode hẏm bet hẏs dede vorto amende,
"And þoȝte on þe grete oþ, þat he hym adde er ẏdo,
"To wyte hym wel Engelond, & to spouse hẏs doȝter also,
"And hulde hẏm þerof vorewarde, as he bẏ het ek þe kẏnge,
"And bote he dude bẏtẏme, he wolde sende hẏm oþer tẏþẏng,
"And seche hẏm out ar tuelf monþe, & hẏs rẏȝtẏs wẏnne,
"þat he ne ssolde abbe in to al Engelond, & erne to wyte hẏm.
Harald hẏm sende word, "þat folẏe ẏt was to truste
"To such oþ, þat was ẏdo mẏd strengþe, as he wel wuste.
"Vor ȝẏf a maẏde treuþe plẏȝte, to do a fole dede
"Al one priuẏlẏche, wẏþ out hyre frendes rede,
"þulke vorewarde ẏs vor noȝt. & wat loker ẏt aȝte her,
"þat ẏch suor anoþ, þat was þo al in þẏ poer,
"Wẏþoute consel of al þe londe, of þẏng þat mẏn noȝt nas?
"þeruor ned oþ ẏsuore, nede ẏbroke was.
"And ȝẏf þou me wolt seche in Engelond, ne be þou no so sturne
"Syker þou ne ssalt me fẏnde in none hurne.
þo Willam hurde, þat he wolde sustenẏ hys trecherẏe,
He let of sende hys knẏȝtes of al Normandẏe,
To conseyly hẏm in þys cas, & to helpe hẏm in suche nede,
And he gan of her porchas largelyche hem bede,
As hii founde suþþe in Engelond, þo ẏt ywonne was,
þe betere was toward hẏm her herte vor þẏs cas.
þe duc Wẏllam hys wẏlle among hem alle seẏde,
þat four þẏnges hym made mest bẏgẏnne þulke dede.
Vor Godewyne, Haralde's fader, to deþe let do
So vẏllẏche Alfred, hẏs cosyn, & hẏs felawes also.
And vor Harald adde hẏs oþ ẏbroke, þat he suor mẏd hẏs rẏȝt honde,
þat he wolde to hẏs byofþe wytẏe Engelond.
And vor Seynt Edward hẏm ȝef Engelond al so.
And vor he was next of hys blod, & best wurþe þerto,
And vor Harald nadde non ryȝt bote in falshede.
þes þẏnges hym made mest bygẏnne þẏs dede.
And vor he wolde, þat all men yseẏe hẏs trywede,
To þe pope Alysander he sende in such cas hẏm to rede.
Haralde's falshede þo he pope ẏseẏ þere,
And perauentere me hẏm tolde more þat soþ were,
þe pope asoẏled & blessed Wẏllam & al hẏs,
þat into þẏs bataẏle mẏd hẏm ssolde ẏwẏs,
And halewede hẏs baner, þat men at vore hẏm bere.
þo was he & al hẏs gladdore þan hii er were.
So þat þẏs duc adde aȝen heruest al ȝare
Hẏs barons & hẏs knẏȝtes, mẏd hẏm vorto fare.
To þe hauene of Seẏn Walrẏ þe duc wende þo
Mẏd þe men þat he adde, & abẏde mo.
After heruest þo her ssẏppes & al hii preste were,
And wẏnd hem com after wẏlle, her seẏles hii gon rere,
And hyderwarde in þe se wel glad þen weẏ nome.
So þat bẏsẏde Hastẏnges to Engelond hii come,
Hem þoȝte, þo hii come alond, þat al was in her honde.
At see sone as þe duc Wẏllam hẏs fot sette alonde,
On of hẏs knẏȝtes ȝradde, "holde vaste Wyllam nou
"Engelond, vor þer nẏs non kẏng bote þou.
"Vor syker þou be, Engelond ẏs nou þẏn ẏwẏs.
þe duc Wẏllam anon verbed al hẏs,
þat none nere so wod, to robbẏ, ne no manere harm do þere
Vpe þe lond, þat hẏs was, bote hem þat aȝen hẏm were.
And an fourtẏ nẏȝt hẏ bẏleuede þere aboute,
And conseẏlede of bataẏle, & ordeẏned her route.
Kẏng Harald sat glad ẏnou at Euerwyke atte mete,
So þat þer come a messager, ar he adde ẏ ȝete,
And seẏde, þat duc Wẏllam to Hastynges was ẏcome,
And hẏs baner adde ẏrerd, & þe contreẏe al ẏnome.
Harald, a man wẏþ grete herte corageus ẏ nou,
As he of non man ne tolde, þuderwarde vaste drou.
He ne let noȝt clupẏe al hẏs folc, so wyllefol he was,
And al vor in þe oþer bataẏle hẏm vel so vaẏr cas.
þo þe duc Wẏllam wuste, þat he was ẏcome neẏ,
A monek he sende hẏm in message, & dude as þe sleẏ,
þat lond, þat hẏm was ẏgẏue, þat he ssolde ẏt vp ȝelde,
Oþer come, & dere em þe rẏȝt myd suerd in þe velde.
ȝẏf he seẏde, þat he nadde non rẏȝt þerto,
þat vp þe pope lokẏnge of Rome he ssolde ẏt do,
And he wolde þerto stonde, al clene wyþoute fẏȝte,
Wer Seẏnt Edward ẏt hym ȝef, & wer he adde þerto rẏȝt.
Harald sende hẏm word aȝen, þat he nolde hẏm take non lond,
Ne non lokẏnge of Rome, bote suord & rẏȝt honde.
þo ẏt oþer ne mẏȝte be, eẏþer in hẏs sẏde
Conseẏlede and ȝarked hem, bataẏle vorto abẏde.
þe Englẏsse al þe nẏȝt byuore vaste bẏgon to sẏnge,
And spende al þe nẏȝt in glotonẏe & in dryngynge.
þe Normans ne dude noȝt so, ac hii crẏde on God vaste,
And ssrẏue hem ech after oþer, þe wule þe nẏȝt ẏlaste,
And amorwe hem lete aselẏ wyþ mẏlde herte ẏnou.
And suþþe þe duc wẏþ hẏs ost toward þe bataẏle drou,
An stounde he gan abẏde, & hẏs knẏȝtes rede.
"ȝe knẏȝtes," he seẏde, "þat bet of so noble dede
"þat nere neuere ouercome, ne ȝoure elderne naþemo,
"Understondeþ of þe kẏng of France þat ȝoure elderne dude wo,
"Hou mẏ fader in Parus amẏdde hẏs kẏnedom,
"Myd prowesse of ȝoure faderes mẏd strengþe hẏm ouercome.
"Understondeþ hou ȝoure elderne þe kyng nome al so,
"And helde hẏm vorte he adde amended þat he adde mẏs do,
"And Rẏchard, þat was þo a chyld, hii ȝelde Normandye,
"þat was duc her bẏuore, & to such maẏstrie,
"þat at eche parlement, þat he in France were,
"þat he were ẏgurd wyþ a suerd, þe wule þat he leuede þere,
"þat þe kẏng of France ne hẏs so hardy were,
"þat atte parlement knẏf ne suerd bere.
"Understoundeþ eke þe dedes, þat þulke Rẏchard dude al so,
"þat he ne ouercome noȝt kynges alone, ac ȝut more þerto.
"Ac he ouercom þe deuel, & adoun hẏm caste
"To gadere as hii wrastled, & bond hẏs honden vaste
"Bẏ hynde at hẏs rugge. of such prowesse ȝe þenche,
"Ne ssame ȝe noȝt þat Harald, þat euere was of luþer wrenche,
"An bẏuore ȝou was versuore, þat he wole mẏd hẏs taẏle
"Turne hys wombe toward vs, & hẏs face in batayle.
"Vnderstondeþ þe suẏkedom, þat hẏs fader & he wroȝte,
"And hii þat mẏd hẏm beþ, þo hii to deþe broȝte
"So vẏllẏche Alfred mẏ cosẏn, & ȝoure kunes men also.
"Hou myȝte in enẏ wẏse more ssame be do?
"Monẏe, þat dude þulke dede, ȝe mowe here to daẏ ẏseẏ.
"Hou longe ssole her luþer heued aboue her ssoldren be?
"Adraweþ ȝoure suerdes, & lokeþ wo maẏ do best,
"þat me se ȝoure prowesse fram þe Est to þe West.
"Wote awrete þat gentẏl blod, þat so vẏllẏche was ẏnome
"Of houre kunes men. vor we mowe wel. vr tẏme ẏs nou ẏcome.
þe duc nadde noȝt al ẏsed, þat mẏd ernest gret
Al ys folc wel atyled to þe bataẏle sscet.
A sueẏn, þat het Taẏlefer, smot vorþ byuore þere,
And slou anon a Englysse man, þat a baner bere,
And efsone anoþer baneur, & þe þrẏdde almest al so,
Ac hẏm sulf he was aslawe, ar þe dede were ydo.
þe furst ende of hys ost bẏuore Harald mẏd such gẏnne
So þẏcke sette, þat non man ne myȝte come wẏþynne,
Wẏþ stronge targes hem bẏuore, þat archers ne dude hem noȝt,
So þat Normans were ney to grounde ẏbroȝt.
Wyllam byþoȝte an queintyse, & bygan to fle vaste,
And hẏs folc vorþ wyþ hẏm, as hii were agaste,
And flowe ouer a longe dale, & so vp an heẏ.
þe Englysse ost was prout ẏnou, þo hii þẏs ẏseẏ,
An bygonne hem to sprede, & after þen weẏ nome.
þe Normans were aboue þe doune, þe oþere vpard come,
And bẏturnde hem aboue al heselyche, as yt wold be adon∣ward.
And oþer byuore ne myȝte noȝt so quiclyche vpard.
And hii were byuore al to sprad, þat ne mẏȝte bytuene hem wende.
þe Normans were so wel porueẏd aboute in ech ende,
And stones adonward slonge vp hem ẏ nowe,
And mẏd speres & myd flon vaste of hem slowe,
And mẏd suerd & myd ax. vor hii, þat vpard nome,
Ne myȝte non wẏlle abbe of dunt, as hii þat donward come,
And her vantwarde was to broke, þat ne myȝte wyþynne hem wende,
So þat þe Normans vaste slowe in eche ende.
Of Englysse al vor noȝt þat valeẏe was neẏ
As heẏe ẏfuld mẏd dedemen, as þe doune an heẏ.
þe ssetares donward al uor noȝt vaste slowe to grounde,
So þat Harald þoru þe neye ẏssotte was deþe's wounde.
And a knyȝt þat ysey, þat he was to grounde ybroȝte,
And smot, as he laẏ bẏneþe, & slou as vor noȝt.
Fram þat ẏt was amorwe þe bataẏle ẏlaste strong
Vorte ẏt was neẏ mẏd ouernon, & þat was samdel long.
Monẏ was þe gode dunt, þat duc Wẏllam ȝef adaẏ.
Vor þre stedes he slou vnder hẏm, as muche folc ẏsaẏ
Ver prẏked, & ver arnd about, & ver wounded also,
And debrẏsed aȝen dedemen, ar þe bataẏle were ẏdo.
And ȝut was Wyllam's grace þulke daẏ so gode,
þat he nadde no wounde, war þoru he ssedde an drop blod.
þus, lo! þe Englẏsse volc vor naȝt to grounde come
Vor a fals kẏng, þat nadde non rẏȝt to þe kẏnedom,
And come to a nywe louerd, þat more in rẏȝte was.
Ac her noþer, as me may ẏseẏ, in pur ryȝt nas.
And þus was in Normannes hond þat lond ẏbroȝt ẏwẏs,
þat anaunter ȝẏf euermo keuerynge þereof ẏs.
Of þe Normannes beþ þẏs hey men, þat beþ of þys lond,
And þe lowe men of Saxons, as ẏch vnderstonde.
So þat ȝe seþ in eyþer sẏde wat ryȝte ȝe abbeþ þerto,
As ẏch vnderstonde, þat yt was þoru Gode's wẏlle ẏdo.
Vor þe wule þe men of þẏs lond pur heþene were,
Non lond, ne no folc aȝen hem in armys nere.
Ac nou suþþe þat þet folc auong Cristendom,
And wel lute wule hii hulde þe bẏheste, þat hii nome,
And turnede to sleuþe, & to prute, & to lecherẏe,
To glotonẏe, & heẏe men muche to robberẏe,
As þe gostes in a uẏsẏon to Seynt Edward seẏde,
Wu þer ssolde in Engelond come such wrecchede,
Vor robberye of heẏ men, vor clerken hordom,
Hou God wolde sorwe sende in þẏs kynedom.
Bytuene Mẏhelmasse & Seynt Luc, a Seyn Calyxte's daẏ,
As vel in þulke ȝere in a Sater daẏ,
In þe ȝere of Grace, as yt vel al so,
A þousend & syxe & syxtẏ, þẏs batayle was y do.
And duc Wẏllam was þo old nẏne & þrytty ȝer.
And on & þryttẏ ȝer he was of Normandẏe duc er.
þo þẏs batayle was ẏdo, duc Wẏllam let brẏnge
Vaẏre hẏs folc, þat was aslawe, anerþe þoru alle þẏnge.
Alle þat wolde leue he ȝaf, þat hẏs fon anerþe broȝte.
Haralde's moder vor hẏr sone wel ȝerne hẏm bẏsoȝte
By messagers, & largelẏche hym bed of hyr þẏnge,
To grante hyre sone bodẏ anerþe vorto brynge.
Wyllam ẏt sende hẏr vaẏre ynou, wyþoute eny þynge waruore:
So þat ẏt was þoru hẏre wyþ gret honour ẏbore
To þe hous of Waltam, & ybroȝt anerþe þere,
In þe holẏ rode chẏrche, þat he let hym sulf rere,
An hous of relygyon, of canons ywys.
It was vaẏre anerþe ẏbroȝt, as ẏt ȝut ẏs.
Wẏllam, þẏs noble duc, þo he adde ẏdo al þẏs,
þen wey he nome to Londone he & al hẏs,
As kẏng & prince of lond, wyþ nobleẏe ẏnou.
Aȝen hẏm wyþ vaẏre processyon þat folc of toun drou
And vnderuonge hym vayre y nou, as kẏnȝ of þẏs lond.
þus come, lo! Engelond into Normannes honde.
And þe Normans ne couþe speke þo bote her owe speche,
And speke French as dude atom, & here chẏldren due al so teche.
So þat heẏmen of þys lond, þat of her blod come,
Holdeþ alle þulke speche, þat hii of hem nome.
Vor bote a man couþe French, me tolþ of hẏm wel lute.
Ac lowe men holdeþ to Englyss, & to her kunde speche ȝute.
Ich wene þer ne be man in world contreẏes none,
þat ne holdeþ to her kunde speche, bote Engelond one.
Ac wel me wot vorto conne bothe wel ẏt ẏs,
Vor þe more þat a man con, þe more worþ he ẏs.

LG.L: ÞS noble duc Wẏllam hym let crounẏg kẏng
At Londone amẏdewynter daẏ, noblyche þoru alle þẏng,
Of erchebẏssop of Euerwẏk, Aldred was hẏs name.
þer nas prince in þe al worlde of so noble fame.
Of þe heẏe men of þẏs lond, þat hii ne ssolde aȝen hẏm turne,
Hii effte ostage strong ẏnou, & me ne dorste hẏm noȝt wurne,
Ac stok him ostage god at ẏs owe wylle,
So though anẏ a ẏenste hem were, he helde him self stille Ar. So þat ȝẏf enẏ aȝen hẏm was, huld hym þo stẏlle.
ȝyf toward Edgar Adelẏng enẏ hẏs herte drou,
þat was kunde eẏr of þys lond, He was stẏlle i now Ar. huld hẏm stylle ynou.
So þat þo þẏs Edgar ẏseẏ al hou ẏt was,
For to wende him oute of this londe he caste him in such cas Ar. þat hẏm nas noþyng so god, as to fle þe cas,
Hẏs moder & hẏs sostren tuo myd hẏm sone he nome,
To wende aȝen to þe lond, fram Whenne Ar. wan he er come.
A wẏnd þer com þo in þe see, & drof hẏm Into Ar. to Scotlonde.
So þat after betere wẏnd hii moste þere A stonde Ar. at stonde.
Macolẏn Ar. Macolon kẏng of þe lond to hẏm sone Him Ar. hem drou,
And vor þe Kyn, of wham he came, honoured him i now Ar. kunne, of was hii come, honourede hem ẏnou.
So þat þe gode Margarete, as hẏs wẏlle To him cam, The elder suster of the twoo, Ar. to com,
þe eldore of þe tuo, in spoushod he Name, Ar. nome,
And bẏ hẏre adde an doȝter suþþe, þe god quene Mold,
þat quene was of Engelond, That goode was i holde, That godderhele alle Enge∣lond, þat ever she was i bore. For thourgh her to the lond com a ẏe the right more Ar. as me aþ er ẏtold,
þat god er hele al Engelond was, heo euere ybore.
Vor þoru hẏre com suþþe Engelond in to þe kunde more.

In þe ȝer of grace Ml. lxx. Ar. sed in marg. ab ead. manu Ml. lxxiio. Anno MLXVII. hoc contigisse notant alii. Videsis Raphaëlis Holin∣shedi chronicae editionem pri∣mam sive genuinam (A. D. 1577. Londini excusam,) in vol. nimirum primi parte Scotica, pag. 254. a þousend & syxtẏ″ þerto
Kyng Macolyn of Scot∣lond spoused this maẏde so Ar. Macolom spousede Margarete so.
Ac kẏng Wẏllam þer bẏuore about an tuo ȝer
Wende aȝen to Normandye, fram wan he com er,
As in vorste ȝer, þat he auong hẏs kynedom,
Ac aȝen sone to Engelond a Seyn Nycolas daẏ he com,
And knẏȝtes of bẏȝonde see, & oþer men also,
He ȝef londes in Engelond, þat lẏȝtlẏche com þerto,
þat ȝut her eyrs holdeþ alonde monẏ on;
And disherited the Englẏsshe, that he helde his fon Ar. And deserẏted monẏ kunde men, þat he huld hys fon.
So þat þe meste Part Ar. del of hey men, þat in Engelond beþ,
Beþ ycome of þe Normans, as ȝe nou ẏseþ.
And men of relẏgẏon of Normandye al so
He feffede here myd londes, & mẏd rentes al so.
So þat vewe contreẏes Buth here in Ar. beþ in Engelond,
þat monekes nabbeþ of Normandẏe somþyng in her honde.
Kyng Wyllam bẏþoȝte hẏm ek of þe volc, þat was verlore,
And aslawe eke þoru hẏm in bataẏle bẏuore.
þere, as þe batayle was, an abbeẏ he let rere
Of Seẏn Martẏn, vor her soules, þat þer aslawe were,
And þe monekes wel y nou feffede wyþoute faẏle,
þat ẏs ẏcluped in Engelond, abbeẏ of Deest Ar. þe″ bataẏle.
þe abbey of Came also he rerde in Normandye
Of Seẏn Steuene, þat ẏs nou, ẏch wene, a nonnerẏe.
He Halp vp eke other houses Ar. broȝte vp monẏ oþer hous of relygẏon al so,
To Bote Ar. bete þulke robberẏe, þat hym þoȝte he adde ẏdo.
And erles eke & barons, þat he made here al so,
þoȝte þat hii ne come noȝt mẏd gode rẏȝte þerto,
Hii rerde abbeyes & prioryes vor her sẏnnes þo,
As Teokesburẏ & Oseneẏe, an aboute monẏ mo.
Kyng Wyllam was to mẏlde men debonere ẏ nou,
Ac sterne to his foomen, or thulke that dud wough Ar. Ac to men, þat hym wẏþsede, to all sturnhede he drou.
In chẏrche he was deuout y nou, vor hẏm ne ssolde non daẏ abẏde,

þat he ne hurde masse & matyns, And alle the other tẏdes. So fareth manẏ heigh men in churche, tha me maẏ see In churche kneleth biddyng as hii wolde to heuen fleo Al quẏc, ac haue theẏ tourned fro the wened wombe, Wolues dedes wolle theẏ do, that thought in churche as lombe. Hii tormenteth hure tenaun∣tes, as hulde hem theẏ wolde i wẏs. They me wepe, and crẏe on hem mercẏ non ther nẏs Ar. & eueson, & eche tyde.
So vareþ monẏe þẏs heẏ men, in chẏrche me maẏ yseẏ
Knelẏ to God, as hii wolde al quẏc to hẏm fle,
Ac be hii arẏse, & abbeþ ẏturnd fram þe wened her wombe,
Wolues dede hii nẏmeþ vorþ, þat er dude as lombe.
Hii to draweþ þe selẏ bonde men, as wolde hem hulde ẏwẏs.
þeẏ me wepe & crẏe on hem, non mercẏ þer nẏs.
Vnneþe was þer eny hous in al Normandẏe
Of relygẏon, as abbeẏ oþer priorẏe,
þat kẏng Wẏllam ne fefede here in Engelond
Mẏd londes, oþer mẏd rentes, þat hii abbeþ ȝut an honde.
As me maẏ wyde aboute in monẏ contreẏe ẏse,
War þoru þẏs lond nede mot þe pouerore be.
Kẏng Wẏllam adde ẏspoused, as God ȝef þat cas,
þe erle's doȝter of Flanderes, Mold ẏr name was.
Sones hii adde to gadere & doȝtren boþe tuo,
As Robert þe Courtehese, & Wyllam þe rede kẏng also,
Henrẏ þe gode kẏng was ȝongost of echon.
Doȝtren he adde al so, Cecyly het þat on
þe eldeste, þat was at Came nonne & abbese.
Constance þe oþer was, of Brutaẏne contesse,
þe erle's wẏf Aleẏn. Adele ȝongost was,
To Steuene Bleẏs ẏspoused, as God ȝef þat cas,
And bẏ hẏm adde ek an sone, Steuene was hẏs name,
þat suþþe was kẏng of Engelond, & endede mẏd ssame.
Macolon kẏng of Scotland, & Edgar Aþelẏng
(þat best Kẏnde hadde in Enge∣lond bẏ lẏne to be kẏng) Ar. kunde in Engelond adde to be kẏng)
Huld hem euere in Scotland, & poer to hem nome,
To Werre vppon William kyng, when Ar. worrẏ vp kẏng Wyllam, wanne gode tyme come.
And gret compaẏnẏe of heẏ men in Engelond,
þat ne louede noȝt kyng Wẏllam, were þo in Scotlonde.
Vor kyng Macolon alle vnderuong, þat aȝen kẏng Wẏllam were,
And drou hem to hẏm in Scotlonde, & susteẏned hem þere.
To maẏntene his wẏue's brother, as heire of the londe. So that he hadde of bothe Reaumes gret power on hande Ar. Vor Edgar, hẏs wyue's broþer, was kunde eyr of þys lond.
So þat hii adde of boþe þe londes gret poer sone an honde.
Ar kẏnȝ Wẏllam adde ẏbe kẏng follẏche þre ȝer,
The Ar. þat folc of Denemarch, þat This londe i werried hadde er, Ar. þẏs londe worrede er,
Greyþed hem mẏd gret poer, as hii dude er ẏlome,
And mẏd þre hondered ssypuolmen to Engelond Deest Ar. hii″ come.
Hii arẏuede in þe Norþ contreẏe, & Edgar Aþelyng
And kyng Macolom were þo glade þoru alle þẏng.
To hem hii come at Homber myd þe poer of Scotlond,
And were alle At on coun∣seille to werre Ar. at conseẏl to worrẏ Engelond.
Hii Robbed Ar. worrede al Norþhomberlond, & vorþ euere as hii come.
So þat þe toun of Euerwyke, & þe castel ek hii nome,
And monẏ heẏ men al so of þe contreẏe aboute.
So þat The folke by ne durst nowhar route. So that when∣ne they hadde i wonne the countreẏ a boute wẏde, Ar. þet folc byuore ne dorste nour at route.
And þo hii adde al ẏwonne þe contreye þere bẏsyde,
Hii ne come no ver Souþward, Ac ther gonne Ar. at þere hii gonne abẏde
Bẏtuene þe water of Trente & of Ouse al so.
þere hii Bẏ lefte with her Ar. byleuede in her poer vorte wẏnter were ẏdo.

Kẏng William the Somer bẏ fore was wende to Normandẏe, And hadde others and seurte of alle the chiualrẏe Of En∣gelond atte Saresburẏ, while he of londe were. And while he was his enmẏs came in this manere. Kẏng William of this cas in Normandẏe hurde, Ac netheles for wẏn∣ter was past in Normandẏe he furde. And thenne oute of Normandẏe into this londe he cam. So grete power of thulke londe and of Fraunce he nam With him in to En∣gelond of knẏghtes & quẏers, Sper men and archers, and also abblastres, That hem thought in Engelonde so muche folke ther nas. Won∣der was hit how that peple susteẏned was. The ennemẏs ne had pouer non a ẏen him fort to stonde, Ac lete the kẏng the mastrẏ, and flow in∣to Scottelonde. And home into hur awne londe Ar. þe kẏng Wẏllam abod his tẏme vorte wynter was al oute,
And þo com he myd such poer & mẏd so gret route,
þat hii nadde non poer aȝen hẏm vorto stonde,
At lete þe kẏng þe maẏstrẏe, & flowe to Scotlond.
And hem to her owe lond þe Deneẏs flowe aȝe.
þe kẏng destrude þe contreẏe al aboute þe see,
Of frut & of corne þat There bẏ lefte nought Ar. þer ne bẏleuede noȝt
Syxtẏ mẏle fram þe se, þat nas to grounde ẏbroȝt.
That the Danes, whanne theẏ come, no mete Ar. And al þat þe Deneẏs non mete ne founde þere
Wanne hii come to Werrẏ, Ar. worrẏ, & so þe feblore were.
So þat ȝut to þẏs day muche lond þere ẏs
As al wast & vntuled, so ẏt was þo destrud ẏwẏs.
Kẏng Wyllam adauntede Eke the folke Ar. þat folc of Walẏs,
And made hem ẏeve hẏm hostage to do no more a mẏs Ar. bere hym truage, & bẏhote hẏm & hẏs.
þe seneþe ȝer of hẏs kynedom, an alle soule daẏ,

þe quene Mold Hac de re lectu digna sunt quae in Cod. Ar. observa∣vit auctor prosaicus. quae sane integra hîc describere visum est. Hit is to remembre, (inquit ille) that Cronicles telleth, that, a monge other vertues that kẏng William hadde in his ẏouthe, he was so chaste, that open fame was he mẏght nat dele with women, and that, sumwhat a ẏenst his wille, thourgh counsell of his lordes, he was maked wedde quene Maude, whiche plesed him welle, and were longe of gode accorde. But natheles some seide atte laste of his tẏme he shulde haue take to concubyine a preste's dough∣ter, whiche Maude the quene by a certaẏne priue seriaunt of hure shulde haue do slaẏne. Whiche thẏnge the kẏng a∣spiẏng, he dishereted the man, and bette so his wẏf with a brẏdell, that sheo deẏde after, bute this is not to leue, sethe the Cronicle, of such a kyng. but this was the sothe. In hure last daẏes a litell feẏn∣ẏng and debat bi twixte hem was, for Robert Curthose her sone, to which the moder of hure rentes ẏaf fẏndẏng, as me seide. Natheles, for all that, the kẏng ne shewed, that he ne dude to the quene as spousod asked, suthe that at hure deẏng he dude grete worship and coste a boue her, and wepte and long maked deel, and worshipliche buried. Fower ẏere she deẏde to fore the kẏng, and was i buried at Came in Normandye, in the munstre of the holẏe Trẏ∣nẏte. hẏs wẏf deẏde, þat wel longe er sẏk laẏ,

Als in the ẏere of grace. XX. Ml. iiii. and iii. ẏere. Faẏre fruẏt to the kyng she hadde brought forth ere. The kyng William Ar. in quo quidem recte, secus atque in Codice Har∣leyano, A. D. 1083. Matildem obiisse significatur. Utrobique autem (tam nimirum in Cod. Harleyano quam & in Ar.) per∣peram asseritur, mortem conti∣gisse anno regni Guilielmi 7mo. quum re vera acciderit anno regni 17mo. In þe ȝer of grace a þousend & seuentẏ & þre.
Anon in þulke sulue ȝer as ẏt wolde be

þe kẏng Wẏllam, vorto wẏte þe wurþ Of his londe Ar. cum Codice MS. Cottoniano, è quo locum hunc edidit cl. Sel∣denus, in Jani Ang. facie al∣tera, p. 66. ed. London 1610. Vide etiam ejusd. Seldeni tractatum Anglice scriptum, cui tit. England's Epinomis, pag. 13. of lond,
Let en querẏ Trusteliche through∣oute alle Ar. streẏtlyche þoru al Engelond,
Hou monẏ plou lond, & hou monẏ hyden al so,
Were in euerẏche ssẏre, & wat hii were wurþ þerto;
And The rentes Ar. cum Cod. Cot. rentẏs of ech toun, & þe wateres echone,

And the worthe of wodes eke, that there [that there quo∣que Cod. Cot.] bẏ lafte none. And lete hit write in a boke, and dude the boke i wẏs In the Tresourẏe of Westmẏn∣stre, as hit ẏut ther is. So that other kynges suthe, tail∣lage whanne theẏ toke, Hii founde what folke mẏght ẏene redẏ in thulke boke Ar. & in margine, è regione, ab ead. manu, ¶ Domes∣day or Lande boke. þet wurþ, & of wodes ek, þat þer ne bẏleuede none,

But that he wist wat hii were wurth of al Engelonde, And wite al clene that wurth there∣of ich vnderstond, And let it write clene inou, and that scrit dude iwis Cod. Cot. þat he wuste wat hii were wurþ, & so vnder stonde
And wyte al clene y nou, & þet wryt dude ẏwẏs
In þe tresorẏe at Westmẏnstre, þere Deest in Cot. as″ ẏt ȝut ẏs.
So þat oure kẏnges suþþe, wanne hii raunsom toke,
And redy Cot. I redẏ wat folc myȝte ȝẏue, hii founde þer in Yor Cot. her boke.
þere was bẏ kẏng Wyllame's day worre & sorwe ẏ nou,
Vor non Man durste him with segge, they me dude him wough Ar. man ne dorste hẏm wẏþ segge, he wroȝte muche wyþ wo.
To hem, þat wolde hẏs wylle do, debonere he was & mylde,
And to hem, þat hym wẏþ seẏde, strong tẏrant & wẏlde.
Wo so come to esse hẏm rẏȝt of enẏ trespas,

Bote he Paide ther fore the bette, the worsse at ende hit was. Thourghoute alle Engelond ẏut neuerthe∣les He made, that me mẏght goo fro toune to toune in pes, In forestes eke and other stedes, so that no tẏme nas, That pees bet meẏntaẏned thanne bẏ hẏs tẏme was Ar. paẏde hẏm the bet, þe worse hys ende was,
And þe more vnrẏȝt me ssolde do hẏm, hac among oþere naþeles
þoru out al Engelond he huld wel god pes.
Vor me mẏȝte bere by hẏs daẏe & lede hardelyche
Tresour aboute & oþer god oueral apertelẏche
In wodes & in oþer studes, so þat non tẏme nas
þat pes bet ẏsusteyned, þat bẏ hẏs tyme was.
Game of hondes he louede ẏ nou, And eke of Ar. & of wẏlde best,
And hẏs Fo∣resters of wodes, but most the Ar. forest & hẏs wodes, & mest þe nẏwe forest,
þat ẏs in Southampshire, that he loued i nough. With wilde bestes he stored hit, & dude somdelle wough Ar. Souþhamtessẏre, vor he þulke louede y nou,
And astored ẏt wel mẏd bestẏs & lese mẏd gret wou.

Vor he caste oute of House and home men welle gret route, And of her londes forest made. XXX. mẏle a boute. To kynges blode ther inne suth hath falle mẏscheuẏng. For his sone ther inne was shot William the rede kyng. And his other sone Richard, that caught his deth also. And Richard, Curthose's sone, the brake his nek a two Ar. hom & hous of hẏs men gret route,
And bẏ nome her lond ȝe þrẏttẏ mẏle & more þer aboute,
And made yt al forest & lese, þe bestes vorto fede.
Of poueremen deserẏted he nome lutel hede.
þeruore wẏþẏnne vel monẏ mẏs clemiẏge,
And hẏs sone was þer ynne ẏssote Wyllam þe rede kẏng,
And hẏs sone, þat het Rẏchard, caȝte þer hys deþ al so.
And Rychard, hys oþer, vor brec þere hys necke atuo
As he rod an honteþ, & perauntre hys hors Spurned Ar. spurde.

þe vnrẏȝt ẏdo to poueremen to suche mẏsauntre De qui∣bus quidem omnibus infortu∣niis operae pretium est consu∣lere acperlegere Henrici Spel∣manni opus eximium (licer post∣humum) cui tit. The History and Fate of Sacrilege, ex apo∣grapho nostro (à memet, jam admodum juvene, in aedibus Amici, dum viveret, optimi ac pererudit FRANCISCI CHER∣RII Shottesbrochianis, cujus e∣quidem viri Maximi impensis ac curae imprimis tribuendum est, quod in re litter aria aliquid profecerim, descripto) A. D. 1698. editum, ubi (pag. 114, &c.) historiam satis luculen∣ter explicuit Spelmannus. turnde.

Hii that bẏ kyng Wil∣liame's daẏ slow hert or hẏnde, Her eyȝen shulde be put oute and made starke blẏnde. Me ne durst by his daẏ wilde best nyme noght, Nother wilde swẏne ne hare, but hit were dure bought Ar. Wo so by kyng Wyllame's daẏ slou hert oþer hẏnde,
Me ssolde pulte oute boþe hẏs eẏe, & make hẏm pur blẏnd.
Heẏe men ne dorste bẏ hẏs daẏ wẏlde best nyme noȝt,
Hare ne wẏlde swẏn, þat hii nere to ssame ẏbroȝt.
þer nas so heẏ man non, þat hẏm enes wyþ seẏde,
þat me ne ssolde hẏm take anon, & to prison lede.
Monẏe heye men of þe lond in prison he huld strong,
So þat Muche del of the londe thought Ar. muchedel Engelond þoȝte hẏs lẏf to long.

Bẏssopes & abbates to hẏs Wille he mak∣ed euery chone, And if anẏ him mispayde, doune he shulde a none. Causes wolde he caste to hem to haue hem in destresse, As he to Seẏnt Wolstone dude bẏ cause of lewednesse. Thries bare he Croune a ẏere, Ar. wẏlle echon,
And ȝyf þat enẏ hẏm wraþþede, adoun he was anon.
þre syþe he ber croune aȝer, to Mẏdewẏnter at Gloucestre,
To Wytesontẏde at Westmẏnstre, to Estre at Wẏncestre.
þulke festes he wolde holde so noblẏche,
Wẏþ so gret prute & wast, & so rẏchelẏche,

þat wonder ẏt was Whens hit come, to susteẏne suche a nobley. But natheles of pouer men cam muche of this praye. Riche i nough he made him self, this londe pouer i nough thourgh oute Ar. wanene ẏt com. ac to snsteẏnẏ such noblẏe,
He destrude þat pouere volc, & nom of hem hys preẏe.
So þat he was rẏche hym sulf, & þat lond pouere al out.
Sturne he was þoru out al, & Aẏfull Ar. heẏuol & prout.
Suyþe þẏcke man he was, & of grete strengþe,
Gret Wombed Ar. womede & ballede, Ac but Ar. & bote of euene lengþe.
So stẏf man he was in harmes, in ssoldren, & in lende,
þat vnneþe enẏ man myȝte hẏs bowe bende,
þat he wolde hym sulf vp hẏs fot rẏdẏnge Full Ar. wel vaste
Lyȝtlẏche, Bende, and shete with bowe and arbelast. So hert hole Ar. & ssete al so mẏd bowe & arblaste.
So hole he was of bodẏ ek, þat he ne laẏ ueuere vaste
Sẏk in hẏs bed vor none vnel, bote in hẏs deþ Deest Ar. vnel″ atte laste.
As he wolde sometẏme to Normandẏe Ar. rectius. Engelond wende,
Al þat aȝt was in Engelond he let somonẏ in ech ende
To Salesburẏ touore hẏm, þat hii suore hẏm al þere
To be hẏm trẏwe & holde, þe wule hii of londe were.
þer to he nom gret peẏne of hem, & fram Salesburẏ to Wẏȝtt
He wende, & fram þanene to Normandẏe rẏȝt.
And wule he was out of Engelond, Edgar Aþelẏng
(þat rẏȝt eẏr was of Engelond & kunde to be kẏng)
Made hẏs ȝonge suster, as God ȝef þat cas,
Nonne in þe hous of Romeseẏe, Cristyne hẏre name was.
þat folc com þo of Denemarch here to Engelond sone,
And robbede & destrude, as hii were ẏwoned to done.
þat word in to Normandẏe to kẏng Wẏllam come.
So gret poer of þulke lond & of France he nome
Mẏd hẏm in to Engelond, of knẏȝtes & of squẏers,
Sper men and archers, and also abblastres, Ar. Spermen auote & bowmen, & al so arblastes,
þat hem þoȝte in Engelond so muche folc neuere nas,
Wonder was hit, how that peple here susteẏned was Ar. þat yt was wonder þoru ẏsusteẏned ẏt was.
Hii of Denemarch flowe sone, vor hii nadde non poer.
Ac þat folc of bẏȝonde see byleuede all her,
þat vnneþe al The Ar. þat lond sustẏnance hem vond.
And þe kẏng hem sende her & þer aboute in Engelond
To dẏuerse men, to vẏnde hem mete, more þan her poer was.
Frut & corn þer faylede, tempestes Also ther Ar. þer come,
Lẏȝtynge & þondre ek, þat slou men ẏlome.
Hunger, derth and man∣quellẏng in lond a boute was thoo, Bestes deẏde and fruẏtes faẏled, how mẏght be mor woo? Ar. Manne orf deẏde alaground, so gret qualm þer was þo.
Orf faẏlede & eke corn, hou mẏȝte be more wo?
Sẏknesse com eke among men, þat aboute wẏde,
Wat vor honger, wat vor wo, men deẏde in Everẏ Ar. eche sẏde.
So þat sorwes in Engelond were Full Ar. wel monẏ folde.
þe kẏng & oþer rẏchemen wel lute þer of tolde.
Vor hii wolde euere abbe ẏ nou, wanne þe pouere adde wo.
Seyn Poule's chẏrche of Londone was ek verbarnd þo.
Kyng Wẏllam to Normandẏe þoȝte suþþe atte laste.
He sette hẏs tounes & hẏs londes to ferme wel vaste
Ho so most bed∣eth ther fore, and thogh thẏnges graunted were Ar. Wo so mest bode vore, & alond ẏgranted were
To a man to bere þeruore a certeẏn rente bẏ þe ȝere,
And anoþer com & bode more, he were inne anon.
So þat hii þat bode mest broȝt out monẏon.
Desunt haec duo carmina in Ar. Nere þe voreward no so strong, me boȝte ẏs out wyþ woȝ,
So þat þe kẏng in such manere seluer won ẏnou.″
þo he adde ẏset hẏs londes so mẏd such trecherẏe
So heẏe, & al hẏs oþer þẏng, he wende to Normandẏe,
And þere he dude wow ẏ nou mẏd slaȝt & robberẏe,
And namelyche vp þe kẏng of France, & vp hẏs compaẏnẏe.
So þat in The tonne of Roane Ar. in quo tamen Reẏnes mox infra. toun of Reẏns kẏng Wyllam atte laste,
Vor elde & vor trauaẏl, bygan to feble vaste.
þe kẏng Phẏlẏp of France þe lasse þo of hẏm tolde,
And drof hym to Scorne Ar. busemare, as me ofte deþ þe olde.
"þe kẏng," he seẏde, "of Engelond halt hẏm to hẏs bedde,
"And lẏþ mẏd hẏs gret wombe at Reẏns In childe bedde Ar. achyld bedde.
þo kẏng Wẏllam hurde þẏs, he made hẏm somdel wroþ,
For the scorne that he him sende, and swor a non his othe Ar. Vor edwẏt of hẏs grete wombe, & suor anon þẏs oþ:
"Bẏ þe vprẏsẏnge of Jhesu Crist, ȝẏf God me wole grace sende,
"Vorto make mẏ Churche gange, and brẏng me oute of bende, Ar. chẏrchegon, & bringe me of þys bende,
"Suche wẏues ẏcholle mẏd me lede, & such lẏȝt atten ende,
"þat an hondred þousend candelen & mo ycholle hẏm tende
"Amydde hẏs londe of France, & hẏs prude ssende,
"þat a sorẏ Churche gange Ar. chẏrchegon Lege, ẏcholle. ẏclolle hẏm make arẏs þanne wende.
Voreward he huld hẏm wel, vorto heruest anon,
þo he seẏ þat feldes were fol of Corne and fruẏte echon, As in tẏme that he mẏght most harme do, Ar. corne echon,
Al þe contreẏe fol of frut, wan he mẏȝt mest harm do,
He let gaderẏ hẏs knẏȝtes & hẏs squẏers al so,
And þat were hẏs wẏues, þat he wẏþ hym ladde.
He wende hẏm in to France, & þe contreye ouer spradde,
And robbede & destrude, hẏm ne myȝte non þẏng lette.
þe gret cẏte of Medant Ar. Medes suþþe afure he sette,
Vor me ne mẏȝte non Churche gang Ar. chyrchegong wẏþ out lyȝte do.
þe cẏte he barnde al clene, And the churche also Of oure ladẏ, and an ancras there in hure house, That nolde nat oute ther of as a trewe spouse. And manẏ men and women Ar. & a chẏrche al so
Of oure leuede, þat þer inne was, & an ancre Gode's spouse,
þat nolde vor non þẏng fle out of hẏre house.
And monẏ man & womman ek þer vel in messchance.
So þat a sorẏ Churche gang Ar. chẏrchegong ẏt was to þe kẏng of France.

At whiche assaut to negh the fuẏre William kyng went, Wher thourgh, & of the hote sonne, a maladẏe hym hente. And some sayne, as with his hors he passed a dẏche combe, With his sadel's arson he brused his grete wombe, So that into Nor∣mandẏe he muste a ẏene tho To the cite of Roane, whenne he hadde i doo, To reste his trauaille, and for he was fe∣ble er, And perauenture for wreche that he dude there. Tho he came to Roane so seke he laẏ, His leches loked his a stat, and bẏ his water saẏ, That by no maner waẏ he ne mẏght a scape noght Ar. Kyng Wẏllam wende aȝen, þo al þẏs was ẏdo,
And bygan sone to gronẏ & to feblẏ al so,
Vor trauaẏl of þe foul asaȝt, & vor he was feble er,
And perauntre vor wreche al so, vor he dude so luþer þere.
þo he com to Reyns aȝen, sẏke he laẏ sone,
Hẏs lechẏs loked hys stat, as her rẏȝt was to done,
And ẏseẏe & seẏde al so, þat he ne myȝte of scapẏe noȝt.
þer was sone sorwe y nou among hys men ẏbroȝt.
And he hẏm sulf deol y nou & sorwe made al so,
And namelẏche vor þe Grete Ar. muche wo þat he adde anerþe ẏdo.
He Wepte Ar. wep on God vaste ẏnou, & crẏde His Ar. hym mẏlce & ore,
And byhet, ȝẏf he moste lybbe, þat he nolde mẏsdo nan more.
Er he ssolde þat abbe ẏdo, vor ẏt was þo Deest Ar. to″ late ẏnou.
Atte laste, þo he ẏsey, þat toward hẏs ende he drou,

Hẏs Bi∣queste to fore he made in this maner. Robert Curthose his eldest sone, vnthonkes as hit were, And straẏned bẏ his counseill, he bequath Nor∣mandẏe. Wel ofte this Ro∣bert to his fader had do gret anuẏe. William Rous alle Engelonde he bẏ quath eke thoo. To Henry Beauclere his moder's heritage and his tresoure also. He lete to poure men eke dele muche of his tresourẏe Ar. bẏquide in þẏs manere he made byuore hẏs deþ.
Wyllam, þe rede kẏng, hẏs sone al Engelond he bẏqueþ
þe ȝongere al hẏs porchas; ac, as lawe was & wone,
Normandye hẏs erẏtage he ȝef hẏs eldoste sone
Roberd þe Courtese; & Henry hys ȝongoste þo
He bẏqueþ hẏs tresour, vor he nadde sones nanmo.
He het dele ek poueremen muche of hẏs tresorẏe,
Vor he adde so muche of hem ẏnome in robberẏe.

Churchen also let he a rere, and ẏaf hem tresoure inough, Whiche er to fore in Fraunce he hadde i brent with wough. The Prisoners of Engelond he let deliuere echon, Ar. Chẏrchen he let rere al so, & tresour he ȝef ẏ nou,
To rere vp the chẏrche in France, þat he barnde wẏþ wou.
þe prisons he het of Engelond delyuery echone,
And of Normandẏe also, þat þer ne leuede none.
þo deẏde he in þe ȝer of grace of þousend, as ẏt was,
And four score & seuene, as God ȝef þat cas.
In the xxi. ẏere of the kyngdom of Engelonde also, And his duchẏe of Normandẏ fẏftẏ ẏere a twoo Ar. & rectius quidem xxi. He was kẏng of Engelond four & tuentẏ ȝer al so,
And duc ek of Normandẏe fẏftẏ ȝer & tuo.
Of elde he was Rectissime, ut mihi videtur. Videsis Notas & Spicilegium nostrum ad Guil. Neubrigensem, p. 685. nẏne & fẏftẏ ȝer, þo God hẏm ȝef such cas.
þe Id est, Septembris IXo. morwe after Seynte Marye daẏ þe latere ded was,
In þe abbeẏ of Came buried Ar. Cam ẏbured was, þẏs kẏng;
And Henrẏ, hẏs ẏongeste Ar. ȝonge sone, was at hẏs burẏng.
Ac noþer of hys oþer sones; For Ar. ver in France þo
Roberd Courthese was in sorwe And in werre also Ar. and in wo.
And Wẏllam anon so hẏs fader Engelond hẏm byqueþ,
He nolde noȝt abẏde vorte hẏs fader deþ,
Ac wende hẏm out of Normandẏe anon to Engelonde,
Vorto nẏme hastelẏche seẏsẏne of hẏs londe,
þat was hẏm leuere, þan hẏs fader were.
So þat þer Was none of his sones bute the ẏongeste there Ar. nas of hẏs sones bote þe ȝonge Henry þere.
WLLAM þe rede kẏng anon so he adde tẏdẏnge
Of hẏs fader deþe, he let hẏm crounẏ to kẏnge.
Bẏuore Mẏhelmasse he was ẏcrouned þre dawes & nan mo.
Of þe erchebyssop of Canterbury, Lanfranc þat was þo.
At Westmẏnstre ẏt was ẏdo wytoute long tarẏnge.
Vor ẏt nas noȝt Fourtenẏght Ar. fourtene nẏȝt after hẏs Fa∣der's Ar. fader burẏnge.
That he ne sende a none wide a boute his sonde, And toke othes of men thorgh all Engelond Ar. He sende, as quẏclẏche as he myȝte, hys sonde
Holde oþes þat men hẏm suore þoru al Engelond.
Vor of hẏs eldore broþer he was euere in doute,
So þat me suor hẏm holde Othes alle the londe a boute Ar. oþes in to al þat lond aboute.
Fram Londone to Wẏnchestre he wende to se þere
þe faẏre Abbeẏ, and other werk, that Ar. halle, & oþer bold, þat hẏs fader let rere.
Of hys fader tresorye, þat was in þulke stude,
He delde vor hẏs soule, as he adde hẏm sulf ẏbede.
To chẏrche & to pouere men he ȝef vorst, as he ssolde,
To abbeyes & to priorẏes largẏlyche of hẏs golde.
And to Euerẏ Ar. eche chẏrche of þe lond vẏf ssyllyng me bere,
And to eche contreẏe an hondred pound, to dele pouere men þere.
For the fader hit hadde i nome of poure Ar. Vor me nom er muchedel of pouere men god.
And þe sone Though lu∣ther he were, the fader he vnderstode Ar. ȝut, þeẏ he were ssrewe, þen fader wel vnder∣stod.

Vor strengþe of bodẏ & wysdom our Louerd Him adde i lende, And thulke twoo ẏere at bẏgẏn∣nẏng to Godeward he wende. For Erchebishop Lanfranc him brought to gode rede. But to vnell he tourned, thoo Lanfranc was dede Ar. hẏm here sende,
And atte bẏgẏnnẏnge þulke tuo to God al he ẏt wende,
þe wule þe erchebẏssop Lanfranc broȝt hẏm to god red,
Ac to vnele he ẏt turnde al, þo Lanfranc was ded.
Ar hẏs fader wonne Engelonde longe he was ẏbore,
And Yut was Robert Ar. ȝut Roberd Courthese þe eldore broþer byuore.
Wil∣liam strong and hardẏ was thourgh oute all thẏng, Ar. Stalworde he was & hardy, & god knẏȝt þoru al þẏng,
In bataẏle & in tornemens er Deest Ar. þan″ he were kẏng.
þe vorste ȝer þat he was kẏng, worre gret & strong
Bytuene hẏm & Roberd Courthese þer sprong.
Vor Muche Peple of Ar. muche of þys lond wyllede Roberd Courthese
To be kẏng of Engelond, ȝyf hii myȝte chese.
And vor Roberd was eldore & eẏr, gret folc he sende Thoo Fro Norman∣dẏe to ward Engelond, his fader's bẏ quest for to vndo Ar. also
Fram Normandẏe to worrẏ, & hẏs fader bẏquide vn do.
Ac þe vẏf Portz in Engelong kepte hym in Ar. pors of Engelond kepte hem in þe see,
And adrentte Hem and slow, Ar. & slowe, þat hii come namore aȝe.
Frenssemen in Engelond þer were þo monẏ on,
Byssoppes & knẏȝtes, mẏd kẏng Wẏllam echon.
Als his Eme bishop Ode, as Ich vnder∣stande, Hadde most power of anẏ in this lande, Ar. þe bẏssop Ode wẏþ hem was so wel, ẏch vnderstonde,
þat he toc hẏm poer, as wo seẏþ, of al Engelond,
And he bygan mẏd treson mest to be hẏs fo,
And withdrow other moo fram hẏm for to goo Ar. And to drawe to hẏm þe heẏmen, þat in poer were ẏ do.
As in þe ȝer of grace a þousend ȝer yt was
And four score & eẏȝte, þat bygan þẏs cas.
In Leẏnte in þe god tẏme þys false bẏssop Ode,
And other Frenssh in En∣gelond, of treson vnderstode Ar. And Frensse knyȝtes of Engelond, of þys treson vnderstode,
And heẏmen monẏe of Engelond were ek at her rede.
Anon after Ester hii bẏ gonne hem For to Ar. to sprede,
And robby aboute & berne, & Coun∣treẏes a gaste, Ar. courtes adoun caste,
And wo so eny castel adde, astored hẏm wel vaste.
A byssop, þat het Geffraẏ, & oþere heẏmen Moo, The Castell kepte at Bri∣stowe, suche as hit was thoo Ar. mo
(þat þe castel wuste of Brustowe, such castel as was þo,)
Baþe & al þe contreẏe hii robbede mẏd her route,
And also the Toune of Berkeley, Ar. And in þe oþer alf Berkeleẏe, & þe contreẏe al aboute,
And þe castel of Brẏstowe astorede Welle i now. And the Barons of Hertfordshire dude also grete wow, And the folk of Shorp∣shire, for hii nome alle on rede, Ar. vaste ẏnou.
þe barons of Hereforde dude also gret wou,
And þat folc of Ssropssyre nome hem al to rede,
And robbede Wurcestre ssẏre in lengþe & in brede,
And al þe Countreẏes Ar. contreẏe aboute to þe toune ryȝt.
But to harmẏ the toune ne hadde they no mẏght. For Ar. Ac hii founde in þe toune mony a good knẏȝt.
Vor″ þe byssop of Wurcestre, þat was þo Seyn Wulston,

Was bi take the castell, to warde fro these soon. Seẏnt Wulston thenne cried on God, to shelde hem fro woo. A fewe men of arme oute thenne gonne goo, And thourgh the bone Ar. In þe castel was of Wurcestre, & knẏȝtes monẏ one.
Seẏn Wolston crẏde on God, to ssulde hem fram her fon.
þe knẏȝtes wel ẏarmed wende hem out anon,
And, þoru bone of Seẏn Wolston, & þoru Gode's grace,
Hii slowe & ouercome vẏf þousend in þe place.
An host there was bẏ Northe, Ar. Auarde þer was bẏ Norþe, þat robbede al so vaste
þe contreye of Norþhomberlond, & þe tounes adoun caste.
Anoþer þer was more Souþ, þat Leẏcestressẏre
Robbede & destrude, And eke Northampton shire Ar. & Norþhamtessẏre.
So þat Engelond was vol Of care and woo. Seẏnt Ed∣warde's prophecẏe to sothe come was thoo Ar. of eche wrecchede,
And to soþe come, þat Seẏnt Edward byuore hẏs deþe sede.
þe bẏssop Ode, þat was of þẏs wowe cheuenteẏn,
In Kent was & robbede þere mẏd al hys meẏne.
Kyng Wẏllam ẏseẏ, þat he was Alle in sorow i brought, Ar. in alle sorwe ẏbroȝt,
And, bote he adde help of hẏs men, hẏs Fare was alle nought, Ar. fore nas rẏȝt noȝt,
To hẏs barons he Sent Ar. sende aboute, þat he Most Ar. mest truste to,
And bede hem helpe hẏm in hys nede, oþer hẏs poer was ẏdo.
He bẏhet hem þe best lawes, þat euere were yfounde,
And freo huntẏng and of Taillages for to be vn bounde. The heigh men Ar. To be hẏs helpe aȝen hẏs fon, þat he nere ẏbroȝt to grounde.
þe heẏmen of Engelond, to abbe her lawes gode,
Come to hẏm in hẏs nede, þo hii This pro hẏm in Ar. hẏm vnderstode.
And myd gret ost wende vorþ, & myd Egre mode, Ar. stourde mode,
Toward þe castel of Roucestre, to seche Deest Ar. þe″ bẏssop Ode.
To þe castel of Tonebrugge bẏ þe wey hii come,
And asaẏled hẏm vaste ẏnou, & atte laste hẏm nome.
þo tolde me, þat bẏssop Ode at Penneseẏe was,
þys ost wende þuderward myd wel quyc pas,
And bẏseged þen castel sẏx Wokes Ar wouke wel vaste,
So þat þe folc wẏþẏnne ȝolde hem atte laste,
And þe bẏssop Ode vorst, þo þe kẏng hẏm vond,
He made hẏm, vor hẏs treson, vorsuerẏe Engelond.
Ac vor þe castel of Roucestre, & þe toune al so,
In þe bẏssoppe's poer was, & hẏs folc þerynne ẏdo,

þe kẏng hẏm made þuder Wende, pees for to make, That the folke the rather shulde the castelle vp take. Whenne the kynge's men with the bisshop to Rouchestre come, Hii with inne came oute, and hem alle in nome Ar. wende, mẏd hẏs owe folc to make
þet folc, þat þerẏnne was, þe castel hym vp take.
þo þe bẏssop & þe kẏnge's men to Roucestre come,
Hii wyþynne turnde aȝen, & al hem nome,
And þe kẏnge's men echon in strong prison caste.
Tho the kyng hurde this, he hieghed thu∣der faste, Ar. þo þet word to þe kyng come, þuderward he heẏde vaste,
And þen castel Bẏseged, Ar. bysette, & hem wẏþẏnne agaste,
So þat hii ȝolde þe kẏng vp þe castel atte laste.

Hii, þat mẏȝte of scapẏe, sone her red nome,

So þat þys Cristẏnmen bẏleued atte laste
Maystres in þe velde, mẏd gret wo þeẏ ẏt were,
And of armes, & of oþer þẏnge, gred preẏe aweẏ bere.
So þat hii were þe bet astored, & her ost al so.
In þe bẏgẏnnẏnge of Jule þẏs bataẏle was ẏdo.
þo wende vorþ þẏs compaẏnẏe with monẏ a noble man,
And wonne Tarce wẏþ strengthe, & suþþe Toxan.
And to ẏrene brugge fram þannene hii wende,
And oure Lorde atte laste to Antyoche hem sende,
þat in þe bygẏnnẏng of þe lond of Syrye ẏs.
Anon, vpe Seẏn Luke's Ar. Lucus daẏ, þuder hii come ẏwẏs,

So þat after Cristemasse þe Saracens Her rede nome, And the folke Ar. red nome,

Of Alef & of oþer londes mẏd gret poer ynou,

ȝarked hem a gret ost, (as hii were ywoned to done,)

þe compaẏnẏe of Cristẏnmen þẏs wel vnderstod.

Hii armed hem self and hur hors, and in six partie, Ar. Iarmed & a horse wel, & in sẏxtẏ partye,

þẏs Cristẏne & þys Saracens to gadere hem sone mette,
And as stalwardmen to gadere vaste sette,
And slowe to grounde her & þere, ac þe heþene sẏde
Wax euere More fresshe and fresshe Ar. verss & verss of folc þat com wẏde.
That the Christene to grounde were i brought neigh Ar. So þat þẏs Cristẏnmen were al grounde neẏ.
þo Beumond wyþ hẏs ost þẏs gret sorwe ẏseẏ,
He & Tancred, & her men, þat al versse were,
Smẏte vorþ as noblemen in to þe batayle þere,

So þat her felawes, þat were vp Poẏnte Ar. ponẏt to fle,

Robert Curthose that daẏ manẏ Sa∣razine slow. And after, whenne theẏ seighe her tẏme, with joẏ and blẏsse i now, A ẏen towarde Antioche to reste hem theẏ drow, And manẏ an hefde to Antioche hii brought of hur foon. More joẏ than there was mẏght me se non Ar. Robert verst Courtehese hẏs gode suerd adrou,
And smot anne vp þe helm, & such a stroke hym ȝef,
þat þe scolle, & teþ, & þe necke, & þe ssoldren he to clef.
þe duc Godefray al so god vpe þe ssoldren smot on,
And verclef hym al þat bodẏ to þe ssadel anon.
þe on alf vel adoun anon, þe oþer bẏleuede stẏlle
In þe sadel, þey ẏt wonder were, as yt was Gode's wẏlle.
þẏs hors ber vorþ þẏs haluemon among hẏs felawes echon,
An hii vor þe wonder cas in drede velle anon,
Wat vor drede þer of, & vor strengþe of her fon,
More joẏe þan þere was nas neuere yseẏe non.
In bygẏnnẏnge of Leẏnte þẏs batayle was ẏdo,
And ȝut sone þerafter anoþer þer com al so.
Vor þe Saracens Of Paẏnẏm londe grei∣thed folke i now Ar. in paẏnẏme ȝarked folc ẏnou,
And þat folc, þo ẏt ȝare was, to Antẏoche drou.
þo þe Cristẏne ẏt vnderȝete, aȝen hii wende vaste,
So þat hii mette hem, & smyte an bataẏle atte laste.
Ac þe Cristẏne crẏde al on God, & god ernest nome,
And, þoru þe grace of Jhesu Crist, þe He∣thene Ar. paẏnẏmẏs hii ouer∣come,
And slowe to grounde her & þere, And some flow a none, Ar. & þe oþer flowe anon,
So þat at a narwe brugge þere adrent monẏon.
þere A scaped fewe Ar. of scapede vewe alẏue, so narwe þe brugg was,

Which thẏnges to the Chri∣stene was a joẏfulle cas. The Riuer of dede mennes blode was woxe alle rede. So that a slaẏne and a dreẏnt xii. princes were dede Ar. þat hii nere adreẏnt, oþer aslawe, þere was a uaẏr cas.
þe vrmẏnde water vaste of her blod al red.
Wat adreẏnt, wat aslawe, tuelf princes þere were ded,

þat me clupeþ Amẏralles, hit was gret scomfiture. The Christienne hadde grete i won of hure ar∣mure, Of gold and of siluer also, and after that theẏ nom The hefdes of the hiest ma∣sters, Ar. amẏraẏls, a uayr cas ẏt was on.
þe Cristemen adde of hem of armure gret won,
Of gold & of seluer ek, & þerafter hii nome
þe heueden of þe hexte maẏstres, & to Antẏoche come,
And leẏde Hem in En∣gẏnes, and into the cite hem caste Ar. ẏs in her gẏnnẏs, & in to cẏte ẏs caste.
þo hii wẏþẏnne ẏseẏe þẏs, sore were hii agaste,
þat her maystres were so aslawe, hii gonne drede sore,
And huld ẏt lute worþ, þen toun to Wardẏ more Ar. wẏte more.
þe Cristyne men Also kepte hem so Ar. hem wust ek so vaste wyþoute,
þat hem ne mẏȝte come non mete, þe more was her doute.
A mayster, þat was withẏnne, sende to þe erl Beumond
To ȝelden vp hẏs warde, To kepe him hole Ar. & ben hol & sound.
Ar hẏs felawes were ẏwar, he ȝeld Hit Ar. hym vp þere
Thre toures Ar. þe toures of þe cyte, þat in hẏs warde were.
And tho Ar. þo Beumond þerẏnne was, hẏs baner anon he let rere.
þo þe Saracens ẏt ẏseẏe, hii were somdel in fere,
And huld hem al ouercome. þe Cristẏne anon come,
And þẏs toun vp þẏs luþer men as vor naȝt nome,
An slowe al þat hii founde, bote wuch so mẏȝte fle,
And astored hem of her tresour, as me mẏȝte ẏse.
þus was þe þrẏdde daẏ of Jun Antẏoche ẏnome,
And, Als in þulke half the Ar. as al in þulke sẏde, þe Saracens ouercome.
This was sone wide a bought a paẏnẏm londe i brought. Where fore the Prẏnces of the londe were in grete thought, Ar. þẏs word was sone wẏde in paynẏme ẏbroȝt,
So þat princes in paẏnẏme were of grete þoȝt,
And sende euerẏch after oþer, so þat Corboran,
þat was maẏster of þe grete ost vnder þe Soudan,
And þe kẏng of Jerusalem, & of Da∣maske Ar. Damasse al so,
Gaderede as gret poer, as hii mẏȝte do,
And come vp þẏs Cristẏnmen mẏd gret ost atte laste,
Mẏd þe meste strengþe of paẏnẏme, & bẏseged hem vaste.
Her adde, lo! þẏs Cristemen, as ȝe ssulle ẏhure,
Muche Penaunce and dissese pro wo in Ar. wo, þe wule God Wolde Ar. wolle þat ẏt ssulle dure.
As the Sarazines bẏseged the toune the thridde daẏ, The Christene host smote oute, tho hii tẏme seẏ, Ar. Hii bẏsegede vaste þe toun, so þat þe þrẏdde daẏ
þe Crystene ost smot hẏm, þo he tyme ẏsaẏ,
And hopede to gode nede, ac bote lute worþ yt nas.
Vor of luþer Saracens so gret poer þere was,
þat þe Cristynnemen aȝen flowe Into hure strengthe fawe, Ar. in wel vawe,
And ȝute monẏe, ar hii come in, were ybroȝt of dawe.
In þe toun hii helde Hem fawe Ar. hem, & vawe″ þat hii mẏȝte.
Vor hii nadde poer non wẏþout vorto fẏȝte.
þe Saracens wẏþoute wuste so euerẏch ende,
þat non maner Lege, lyflode, cum Ar. lẏslode ne mẏȝte to hem wende.
So þat hii þo adde ẏspend þat wẏþẏnne was,
More honger þan hii adde neuere ẏseẏ nas.
A neẏ for. ii. s. welle fawe tho me bought, And a hen for xv. s. fawe hoso hit brought, Ar. Vor a neẏ tueẏe ssyllẏnges wel vaw þo hii boȝte,
And an hen to vẏftene, wel vaw þat me ẏs broȝte,
And a note vor a penẏ, Ho that hii ete Hors, houndes, and asses clene hii vp frete Ar. so þat hii ete
Her hors, & her huden ek, & hassen ar hii lete.
Wo þat myȝte weoden abbe, & þe roten gnawe,
And seth and make ther of Potage, Ar. Oþer seþe & makẏe potage, was þerof wel vawe.
Vor honger deẏde monẏon, hou mẏȝte be more wo?
Muche was þe sorwe, þat among hem was þo.
F. non. Sed no in Ar. Nou maner hope hii nadde, to amendement to come.
Vor hii ne myȝte armes Bere, for hunger ouercome Ar. bere, so hii were ouercome.
Atte laste our Lordde suete þoȝte on þẏs dede,
And come to an holẏmon, & þes wordes seẏde.
"Go seẏe þe Cristenmen of þe West ende,
"þat ẏch abbe her bẏuore ẏbe to hem gode & Kẏnde, Ar. hende,
"þat ẏch made hem vorst wẏnne of Nẏce þe cẏte,
"And monẏ oþer bataẏle, þe wule hii seruede me,
"And þe cyte of Antyoche, þat so strong was in ech ende,
"And þo ẏch hem adde al þẏs ẏdo, fram me hii gonne wende,
"And sunne dude of lecherẏe, & þat ẏs mest in mẏ munde.
"With wẏmmen of paẏnẏme hii dude her foule kunde,
"War of þe stench com in to heuene an heẏ.
þe gode man to our Louerde's vet vel þat þẏs ẏseẏ.
"Lordd, ȝẏf ẏt ẏs þẏ wẏlle in þẏs grete nede," he seẏde,
"Help hem, & vor ȝẏf hem L. þulke Ar. þulle sunuol dede.
"Ich hem abbe," quaþ our Lord, "Ofte i holpe er this, Ar. ẏholpe hem er ẏwẏs,
"And ẏcholle her after more; go & seẏe hem þẏs,
"þat hii turne aȝen to me, & ycholle Saunz faille With inne Ar. samfayle,
"And wẏþẏnne vẏf dawes, mẏd hem be mẏ sulf in bataẏle.
Her ȝe mowe ẏse, þat an vewe, þoru sẏnne of lecherye,
Mowe Be nẏme the grace of God to a grete com∣panẏe Ar. bẏnẏme grace of God al an compaẏnẏe.
þẏs holy man wende vorþ, & tolde þẏs men vore,
þat hii adde wonne grace, & wẏ hii ẏt adde vorlore.
þo hii adde ẏwonne grace, gret joye was þere,
In Psalmes pro vastẏng in Ar. vastẏng & in orẏsons þre dawes hii were.
Massen & processẏons hii made monẏ on,
With wepẏng & gode deuocẏon hii lete hem ssrẏue echon.
þo hii were ẏssrẏue wẏþ god deuocẏon,
Wepẏnde hii armed hem, þe teres ourne adoun.
Her ost hii delde aseuene, & þe vorst hii Bẏ toke Ar. toke
þe erl of Flaundres & sẏre Hue þe gret erl to loke.
þe oþer þe duc Godefraẏ & þe erl Baldewẏne also.
þe þrẏdde Roberd Courtehose, þat best ẏt couþ do;1 And with hethen wo∣men dude Ar.
Vor he was best knẏȝt of alle, To him me nolde loke No felawe. And the bisshop the iiiie. host hii bẏ toke Ar. non felawe hii nolde loke.
þe bẏssop of Podẏe þe verþ ost hii toke,
And syre Wyllam de Mounpeẏllers þe vẏfte hii toke ryȝt,
Syre Rychard De Pruices Ar. þe Pruẏce & Tancred þe gode knyȝt.
þe syxte þe erl of Rusẏnele & þe erl Beumond al so
Hii bẏtoke to gouernẏ, & þo al þẏs was ẏdo,
In honour of þe holẏ gost þe seuene hii made þo,
And made þereof cheuenteyn sẏre Reẏmond & namo.
Syre Raẏ∣monde Ar. Reynond with gode compaẏnẏe þen toun wuste bẏ hẏnde,
þat her men, ȝyf hii nede adde, recet mẏȝte fynde.
þo al was prest, as hii wolde, hii blessede hem echon,
And toke hem al to Godde's Ar. God grace, & to bataẏle wende annon.
þere was gret criẏnge on God, & monẏ a wepẏnd eẏe
Of hem, þat byleuede atom, & þe bataẏle ẏseẏe,
For pro of in Ar. Of bẏssopes, & prestes, & men of relẏgyon,
And clerkes þat þere were mẏd god deuocẏon
Reuested hem in Church∣es, and to God Ar. chẏrche, & on God gonne crẏe,
Wepẏnde A pro∣cession, Ar. wyþ processẏon, & songe þe Letanẏe,
and oþer gode orẏsons, to bẏdde vor hem alle,
And vor to see þe bataẏle stode vppe þe toun walle.
þe heþen men in her alf so glade ner neuere,
As hii were vor þẏs bataẏle, in so gret hope hii were.
þo hii were al ȝare in her alf, & Cristẏne men come,
þe ssrewen in þe wẏnd alf get plente of Heth Ar. heẏ nome,
And sette Hit a fuẏre a ẏe the Chri∣stene host euery ende, Ar. aȝen þe Cristenemen afure in ech ende,
þat þe smoke þere of hem ssolde boþe stenche & blende.
Ac our Lord, þat mẏd hem was, bẏgan þe wynd wende,
And þe Smorther Ar. smoke, þat hii made, Cristene men to ssende,
Ryȝt in her owe teþ bẏgan hem euene sende,
So þat ẏt was her owe harm þat hii lete tende.
þe Crẏsten men vp hem come mẏd gode ernest ẏ nou,
And vor þe smoke so euene in her teþ drou,

þe ssrewen nadde no poer non wule to at stonde.
A wel vaẏr compaẏnẏe al so þere com
Of holy men, þat wule þolede martẏrdom,
Vppe vaẏre wyte stedes, & in vayre armure also.
Seẏn George þe vorste was, & oþer martẏrs þerto.
Of montaẏnes hii come adoun, Driuẏng Ar. drẏue vaste ynou
And in eẏther half of the company vpon the threwen [l. shrewen] drough, Ar. In eẏþer alf þe compaẏnẏe vp þe ssrewen drou,
þat hii were to grounde aslawe, & hii flowe, þat mẏȝte.
þus our Lord & Seyn George This hoste couthe Ar. her fon couþe dẏȝte.
þe Cristene men leẏde euere on, & slowe euere to grounde,
Al clene þe ssrewen were ouercome in a stounde.
Anon after Mẏdsomer þẏs bataẏle ẏdo was,
A Seẏn Petre's eue ẏwẏs, as God ȝef þat cas,

Betere bataẏle þere aboute nas neuere ẏ seẏe, ẏch wene.
And amraẏl þere bẏsẏde, þat an castel wuste,
ȝeld hẏm vp to Cristene men, þo he nuste warto truste,

Me ȝeld hem vp wel astored, þo al þys was ẏdo.
So þat þẏs Cristene men so wel astored nere
Of armur, ne of tresour neuere, as hii þo were.

Toward Jerusalem, as God hem wolde sende.″

Weþer ssolde abbe þe cẏte? so þat hii bẏleuede þere

þre monþes, ar hii mẏȝte mẏd strengþe Hine Ar. hẏm wẏnne.

xv. hors Ar. Vẏftẏ hors of prẏs þe kyng of þe londe,

Vor to sette Hure wardes, that hit were wonne Ar. her folc aryȝt, þat þe cẏte were ẏwonne.

In prison was Roberd Quali∣ter Robertus Curtheuse obierit sequentia ante annos aliquot ex∣scripsi è Cod. MS. Bodleiano NE. F. 4. 8. & Collectaneis nostris MSS. (Vol. 59. p. 8.) inserui: Anno Domini Mo. CXXXIIII. cum Dominus no∣ster Ihesus Christus, qui ne∣minem perire desiderat, jam
duci Roberto satis amplum poenitenciae spacium & hu∣miliacionis concessisset, viz. jam fere triginta annorum in orbitate vel carcere transactorum, abusus est illo Dei beneficio. intumuit enim superbia nimis, male∣diccionibus & detraccion∣ibus, qui potius divinis jugi∣ter obsequiis & precibus assiduis incubuisse tenere∣tur, utpote diu afflictus & jam senex. Contigit igitur una dierum festivorum, cum rex novam vestem, quam vul∣gariter robam appellamus, de scarleto sumens, assuetus de eodem superpanno robam fratri suo Roberto trans∣mittere, capam conabatur induere, sed invenit introi∣tum capucii, quod Gulerim Gallice appellatur, nimis artum. Unde contigit, ut u∣nam suturae puncturam tan∣tum confringens, eam depo∣suit, & dixit: Haec capa de∣feratur danda fratri meo Ro∣beto, qui arguicius [lege, argutius] capud me habet. Quae cum ipsi delata fuisset induenda, invenit illam jam dictam puncturam, quae per incuriam Caesaris [pro scis∣soris,] quod minima relin∣quebatur, non resuta. Ut dux, Unde haec, quam censio [sic], fractura? Et nuncius, quae contigerant, seriatim jocando duci referebat. Et dux, quasi alto vulnere sau∣cius, irriguit, dicens, Heu! heu! nunc nimis vivo. Quid adhuc vitam protraho infe∣licem? Ecce frater meus, immo proditor meus & supplanta∣tor, me jam adeo spernit & vilem habet, quod mihi, tan∣quam praebendario suo, pro elemosina sua hos veteres & dissutos transmittit pannicu∣los. Flens igitur & ejulans devovit manducare extunc & deinceps. Nec postea cibum vel potum sumere voluit in semetipso desaeviens & defi∣ciens, & sic mortuus est, & maledicens diei nativitatis suae. Quod cum rex Henri∣cus audisset, non multum infortunio condolens, jussit eum in ecclesia conventuali Gloverniae reverenter sepe∣liri. Ceterum frustra for∣sitan haec exscripsi. Eadem enim habet Matthaeus Paris, sub an. 1134. p. 73. qui & (p. 63.) retulit, oculis privatum fuisse Robertum an. 1107. Male autem haec. Nec quidem firmat Robertus noster Glou∣cestriensis. Rectius illi, qui doceant, illum neutiquam fu∣isse oculis orbatum, sed incar∣cerationem satis lenem ad mortem usque subiisse. Henrie's sone, whanne he was of xvii. yere olde, with Richarde his brother were ordeẏned to wende into En∣gelonde, after the victorye vp∣on Lowẏce kẏng. so that he lete ordeẏne for him selfe a ship, wel a rayed, as felle to his state. And so felle hit, that alle ẏong gentils, of men and of women, drow towarde the kynge's sones, holdẏng a grete thing hoso mẏght be nexte, or towardes, him. So that whan the ship was redy, this William and Richard, with many other, wente to shipe, and gonne to meue oute of the hauene of Barflete. So that the shipmen, or for dronk∣nesse, or for grete gladnesse of the presense of the kẏnge's sones, vnweyselich gouern∣ẏng the ship, set hit vppon a grete Rokke, so that the ship to brak, and William the kẏngus sone, with other, wente into the bote, & mẏght welle haue ascaped. But the Countesse of Perch, his bast Suster, for drede cride so pitousliche to goo in to the bote withe him, that they or∣deẏned to haue hur inne.
